characters: A JUNGLE CLEARING, NOT FAR AWAY
YOU, BUT NOTHING IS BENEATH ME
THIS ISN'T THE END OF IT
AT THE BASE OF THE FALLS
AT THE TOP OF THE FALLS
DECLARE WAR ON PEACE AND HAPPINESS
WRECKAGE CRASHES ON TOP OF THEM, DESTROYING THE PARR
THIS IS GOING TO BE ROUGH

dialogues.speaker: HOGENSON
dialogues.text: “Denied”? You're denying my claim? Her claims adjuster BOB PARR looks up. He looks familiar.

dialogues.speaker: FIFTEEN YEARS LATER
dialogues.text: It’s none other than MR. INCREDIBLE himself, now balding, sixty-four pounds heavier and dressed in a too-tight white collar shirt. Hogenson sits across from him, bewildered and upset. HOGENSON (CONT’D) I don’t understand. I have full coverage.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Mrs. Hogenson, but our liability is spelled out in paragraph 17--

dialogues.speaker: HOGENSON
dialogues.text: I can’t pay for this...

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (phone rings, he answers) Excuse me. Claims, Bob Parr.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELEN PARR chats amiably as she bathes her happy toddler JACK-JACK in the sink of their airy, ranch-style kitchen. Her hairstyle has changed, her hips have widened a little, but Motherhood has agreed with her, and little else has changed from her Elastigirl days. A stack of empty MOVING BOXES are stacked haphazardly near the door.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: I’m calling to celebrate a momentous occasion. We are now officially moved in.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: That's great, honey. And the last three years don’t count because...

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Because I finally unpacked the last box. Now it’s official. Why do we have so much junk?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Listen, honey, I’ve got a client here--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Say no more, go save the world one policy at a time, honey. I gotta go pick up the kids from school. See you tonight.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Bye, honey. (hangs up, turns to Hogenson) Excuse me, where were we?

dialogues.speaker: HOGENSON
dialogues.text: (beginning to weep) I‘m on a fixed income. If you can’t heip me, I don’t know what I’1l1 doi Bob stares at her, empathizing completely. He stands up and leans out of his cubicle, looks down the hallway in both directions, makes sure the coast is clear. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Alright. Listen closely. I'd like to help you, but I can’t. He hands her a pen and a pad of paper. He leans closer, his voice low...

dialogues.speaker: BOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'd like to tell you to take a copy of your policy to Norma Wilcox on the-- He stops and looks up. She’s staring at him blankly, completely puzzled. Bob reaches over and taps her pad. Suddenly understanding, she begins to scribble... BOB (CONT’D) ~-Norma Wilcox, W-I-L-C-0-X on the third floor. But I can’t. I would advise against asking her for a WS-2475 form, which you should not fill out and file with a man named Oliver Jenkins in our legal department on the seventh floor. I wouldn’t expect someone to get back to you quickly to resolve the matter. I'd like to help. (he gives her a little smile) But there’s nothing I can do.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Oh... thank y--

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (interrupting loudly) I’m sorry, Ma’am. I know you’re upset. (low whisper) Pretend you're upset. Understanding, she smiles, stands up, and EXITS weeping. Bob grins; he’s beaten the system. The old lady is gone for a total of six seconds when Bob's supervisor GILBERT HUPH enters. Huph, an anal, micromanaging little troll with a loud voice, throws a folder on Bob’s desk.

dialogues.speaker: HUPH
dialogues.text: Parr! You authorized payment on the Walker policy??

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Someone broke into their house, Mr. Huph. Their policy clearly covers them against--

dialogues.speaker: HUPH
dialogues.text: (interrupting) I don't want to know about their coverage, Bob! Don’t tell me about their coverage! Tell me how you’re keeping Insuricare in the black! Tell me how that’s possible with you writing checks to every Harry Hardluck and Sally Sobstory that gives you a phone call!! Huph leaves. Bob stands there impotently, then sits. Knocking his pencil holder over.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: Helen ENTERS, and sees her son DASH (age 10, bionde hair) sitting hunched in a chair. Before him are two men, Dash’s teacher BERNIE KROPP-~ balding, tense, and looking older than his 36 years, and the school’s PRINCIPAL.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL
dialogues.text: I appreciate you coming down here so quickly, Mrs. Parr. Helen enters and takes a seat. Dash stares at the floor.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: What’s this about? Has Dash done something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: KROPP
dialogues.text: He’s a disruptive influence. And he openly mocks me in front of the class.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: He says.

dialogues.speaker: KROPP
dialogues.text: I know it’s youl! {to Helen) He puts thumbtacks on my stool!

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: You saw him do this??

dialogues.speaker: KROPP
dialogues.text: Well... not r-- no, actually not.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Then how do you know it was him?

dialogues.speaker: KROPP
dialogues.text: I hid a camera. This time I’ve got him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED s Kropp slips a DISC out of his jacket and into a machine hooked up to a TV monitor. Dash REACTS; he didn’t expect this. Helen sees this, shoots Dash a sharp LOOK. IN THE VIDEO: Kropp approaches his stool and sits. Suddenly he JUMPS UP in pain. The students LAUGH. Kropp whirls to the adults in the room expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: KROPP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See?? (gets no response) What, you don’t see it? He is met with BLANK STARES. With an exasperated sound, Kropp REPLAYS the video, PAUSING IT, and pointing to a still-seated Dash. KROPP (CONT’D) He moves!! Right THERE! Right as I’m sitting down! I don’t know how he does it- Kropp forwards and rewinds; back and forth. Though Dash’s image does “pop” a bit, he remains clearly in his seat. KROPP (CONT’D) ~-but there’s no tack on my stool before he moves and after he moves there’s a tack! Coincidence? I think NOT!! Helen jerks her head toward Kropp, gives the Principal a “you see he’s crazy, don’t you?” look. He turns to Kropp-

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL KROPP
dialogues.text: Bernie... Don’t “Bernie” me! This little rat is guilty!!

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL
dialogues.text: (to Helen) You and your son can go now, Mrs. Parr. I'm sorry for the trouble... Helen gives the Principal a thin smile and hustles Dash from the room, leaving Kropp apoplectic.

dialogues.speaker: KROPP
dialogues.text: You're letting him go AGAIN? He's GUILTY! You can see it on his smug little face!!! Guilty guilty GUILTY!! NOOOOO! INSIDE HELEN’S CAR - MOVING Dash stares out the window in angry silence, watching the trees go by. Helen looks at him and softens.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Dash. This is the third time this year you've been sent to the office. You need to find a better outlet. A more constructive outlet.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: Maybe I could. If you’d let me go out for sports.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Honey. You know why we can’t do that.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: But I promise I‘1l slow up! I‘1l only be the best by a little bit...

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Dashiell Robert Parr, you are an incredibly competitive boy. And a bit of a show-off. The last thing you need is temptation.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: You always say, “Do your best,” but you don’t really mean it. Why can’t I do the best that I can do?

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Right now, honey, the world just wants us to fit in. And to fit in we must be like everyone else.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: But Dad always said our powers were nothing to be ashamed of, our powers made us special.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: (wearily) Everyone's special, Dash...

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: Which is another way of saying no one is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shy, insecure VIOLET PARR (14) waits nervously behind a hedge near the front entrance. The bell SOUNDS, signalin the end of the school day. Violet turns toward the door- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ~~-as it swings open, and out steps TONY RYDINGER, handsome, confident and crush-worthy. He pauses and is immediately surrounded by friends. As Tony descends the steps with his pals, tossing cool nods at flirty girls, he passes by Violet, who peers at him over the top of some bushes. He stops, aware of being watched, and looks back--~ SRE’S NOT THERE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: from the other side of the bush REVEALS: Violet's clothes hang in mid-air --WITH NO HEAD. Tony looks directly at the empty space where Violet's head should be and, seeing nothing, gives up and walks away. Violet's head REAPPEARS... blushing. She touches her burning cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: He looked at me...! A car horn HONKS offscreen. Violet hustles across the expansive lawn, through the sea of boys and girls together, to her mother’s waiting station wagon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars stretch off into infinity, idling and immobile. It’s the traffic jam from hell, and right in the middle of it, squeezed into a scruffy car many sizes too small, sits Bob, trying not to be angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pleasant, unexceptional home in a neighborhood full of pleasant, unexceptional homes. Bob’s car pulls into the driveway, the engine sputtering a long time before finally expiring with a tired gasp. Bob steps out and SLIPS on a skateboard left in the driveway. He falls backward, grabbing the roof of the car to steady himself. He pushes the skateboard away, muttering darkly, and notices that he’s inadvertently crumpled the roof with his Super-grip.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Ohhh, great. He decides to let it go, pushes the door closed. It won't go. He tries again, a little harder this time. No go. He SLAMS the door closed, shattering the window.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bob LOSES IT. He seizes the car, lifting it overhead as if readying to fling it over the far horizon and STOPS-- -~a five-year-old neighbor kid on a Big Wheel tricycle, RUSTY MCALLISTER, stares on in SHOCK and AWE. Frozen with the car overhead, Bob stares back... then sets his car down on the driveway and eases into his house as if nothing had happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen spoons baby food into the mouth of JACK-JACK (with all the facial “English” known to parents), most of which Jack-Jack squeezes back out onto his chin... where it is adeptly caught on Helen‘s spoon and reintroduced into the baby’s mouth.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: Mom, you’re making weird faces again.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: (spoons, makes a weird face) No, I’m not...

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: You make weird faces, honey.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: (notices Bob’s newspaper) Do you have to read at the table?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Uh huh. Yeah. Helen SIGHS. She turns her attention to Dash, who is wrestling with an uncut slab of steak.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Smaller bites, Dash! Bob, could you help the carnivore cut his meat? Bob SIGHS, puts down the paper, grabs a knife and fork, reaches over to Dash’s plate, and begins to cut his meat. HELEN (CONT’D) Dash? You have something you want to tell your father about school?

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: uh... well, we dissected a frog...?

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Dash got sent to the office again. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (cutting, not listening) Good... good...

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: No Bob, that’s bad.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Dash got sent to the office again.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: He put a tack on the teacher’s chair. During class.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: Nobody saw me. You could barely see it on the tape.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: They caught you on tape and you still got away with it? Whoa... you must’ve been booking! How fast do you think you were--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Bob, we are not encouraging this--

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: I‘m not encouraging, I'm just asking how fast he was--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Honey! ! A loud CRACK is heard. Bob stops cutting; realizing that he’s sawed right through the table with his dinner knife.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Oh, great. First the car and now I gotta pay to fix the table~-

dialogues.speaker: RELEN
dialogues.text: The car? What happened to the car?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bob rises, gives Dash his plate of food and EXITS into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: I’m getting a new plate.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: (to Vi, forced cheerful) What about you, Vi? How was school?

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Nothing to report.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: You've hardly touched your food.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: I'm not hungry for meatloaf.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Well, it is leftover night. We have steak, pasta-- what are you hungry for?

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: Tony Rydinger...

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: DASH VIOLET
dialogues.text: Well, you are! I said SHUT UP, you little insect!

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: Well, she is!

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Do NOT shout at the table! (to Bob) Honey--?

dialogues.speaker: BOB, (0.S., DISINTERESTED)
dialogues.text: Kids, listen to your mother. Dash and Violet swap GLARES. All resume eating. Then--

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: She'd eat if we were having Tonyloaf.

dialogues.speaker: THAT'S IT--1
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Violet LUNGES across the table, VANISHING (save for her clothes). They wrestle. Dash escapes, racing around the table in a BLUR, SLAPPING at the back of Vi’s head before crashing into a FORCE FIELD she throws in his path.

dialogues.speaker: DASH VIOLET
dialogues.text: OW!! No force fields!! You started it!!

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Stop it! Dash! Violet! Helen’s arms STRETCH across the table as she struggles to keep the KIDS apart. Jack-Jack LAUGHS, loving the chaos.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Oblivious to the melee, Bob gets a new plate from the cupboard, still perusing the newspaper. The headline reads: “PALADINO MISSING”. With it is a photo of a lean, striking man, early forties, sporting wraparound sunglasses and a full head of blonde hair.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (V.0., READING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon J. Paladino, long an outspoken advocate of Superhero rights, is missing. {mutters to himself) Gazerbeam...?

dialogues.speaker: HELEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Bob?? It’s time to engagei! Do something! Bob snaps out of it, turns toward the dining room.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: Bob ENTERS--~ startled to see the CHAOS.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Don’t just stand there! I need you to intervene!

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Okay~- I’m intervening, I’m INTERVENING! Bob hoists the dinner table and everyone with it over his head. Dash and Vi dangle from Helen’s tangled arms and continue to scrap. Jack-Jack shrieks happily. The DOORBELL rings. Everyone FREEZES, then quickly resume their original “quiet dining” positions. Dash answers the door.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LUCIUS BEST (aka FROZONE) stands in the doorway, looking sharp in a leather jacket. Like Helen, he too has weathered the post-Superhero years well.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: Hey, Lucius!

dialogues.speaker: FROZONE
dialogues.text: Hey, Speedo... hey, Helen--

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Ice of you to drop by!

dialogues.speaker: FROZONE
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Hah. Never heard that one before--

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: (mouth full of water) Hey, Lucius! Lucius turns to see Dash spurt a mouthful of water into the air. Best’s hand flashes out; the air CRACKS with a sudden chill and the water FREEZES SOLID. Lucius LEAPS, catches the ice before it hits the ground. Dash sinks back, disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: DASH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Aww. I like it when it shatters.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (grabs his coat, bowling bag) I'll be back later.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Where are you two going?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: It’s Wednesday.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: (remembering) Bowling night. (resigned) Say hello to Honey for me, Lucius.

dialogues.speaker: FROZONE
dialogues.text: Will do. Goodnight, Helen. Night, kids! Bob and Lucius EXIT, closing the front door behind them. Helen turns to Dash.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Don't think that you've avoided talking about your trip to the Principal’s office, young man. Your father and I are still going to discuss it.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: I’m not the only kid who's been sent to the office, y'know.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Other kids don’t have Superpowers. Now it’s perfectly normal for you to feel--

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Normal? What do you know about normal? What does anyone in our family know about normal? The only normal one is Jack~Jack.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Now, wait a minute, young lady--

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: We ACT normal! I want to BE normal! The only normal one is Jack-Jack, and he’s not even toilet-trained! Buoyed by hearing his name, Jack-Jack gleefully spits a mouthful of baby food onto his bib and cracks up.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: Lucky. (off Vi's and Helen's looks) Uh, I meant about being normal. INSIDE LUCIUS‘S CAR - CITY STREETS - MINUTES LATER Bob and Lucius sit in Lucius’s large, comfortable sedan, which is parked in a run-down city neighborhood. A portable POLICE SCANNER sits on the dashboard, volume low, occasionally interrupting his story.

dialogues.speaker: FROZONE
dialogues.text: +,».SO now I’m in deep trouble, I mean one more jolt of this death ray and I’m an epitaph. Somehow I manage to find cover and what does Doctor Toxic do?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (laughing) He starts monologuing--

dialogues.speaker: FROZONE
dialogues.text: He STARTS MONOLOGUING! He starts, like, this prepared speech about how feeble I am compared to him, how inevitable my defeat is, how the world will soon be his yadda yadda yadda~-

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: -~-yammerin’--

dialogues.speaker: FROZONE
dialogues.text: YAMMERIN’!! I mean, the guy has me on a platter and he won’t shut up!

dialogues.speaker: SCANNER
dialogues.text: Six one sam, eight Municiberg... (police response) Go ahead. (dispatch) ...possible 2356 in progress at 115 Weatherford Way-- Bob turns up the volume, suddenly intense.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: 2356. What is that-- robbery?

dialogues.speaker: FROZONE
dialogues.text: This is just sad.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Yeah, robbery. Wanna catch a robber?

dialogues.speaker: FROZONE
dialogues.text: fell the truth, I‘d rather go bowling. What if we actually did what our wives think we're doing, for a change? EXT. LUCIUS’S CAR WIDEN to REVEAL: the silhouette of a WOMAN watching Bob and Lucius from the driver’s seat of a black sports car, discreetly parked in a dark alley. She lowers her binoculars and speaks into a headset.

dialogues.speaker: MIRAGE
dialogues.text: He's not alone. The fat guy’s still with him. They're just talking...

dialogues.speaker: FROZONE
dialogues.text: What're we doin’ here, Bob?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: wee 29. CONTINUED;

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: We're protecting people.

dialogues.speaker: FROZONE
dialogues.text: Nobody asked us.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: You need an invitation?

dialogues.speaker: FROZONE
dialogues.text: I’d like one, yes. We keep sneaking out to do this and-- {stops, thinks) ~~remember Gazerbeam? He had trouble adjusting to civilian life, too.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Yeah, there was something about him in the paper. When was the last time you saw him?

dialogues.speaker: FROZONE
dialogues.text: I don’t see anyone from the old days, Bob. Just you. We’re pushing our luck as it is. It was fun the first time, but we keep doin’ this and-~ The scanner SQUAWKS suddenly-~

dialogues.speaker: SCANNER
dialogues.text: We have a report of a fire at Fourth and Elias.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: A fire! We’re close! Yeah, baby!! Bob pulls a ski mask over his face. Shaking his head at his own complicity, Lucius does likewise.

dialogues.speaker: FROZONE
dialogues.text: ~-we're gonna get caught. He starts the car and U-turns toward the fire.

dialogues.speaker: CITY STREETS
dialogues.text: Bob’s enthusiastic SHOUTS echo off the darkened buildings as the sedan peels off... followed, a beat later, by the MYSTERIOUS BLONDE in the black sports car.  30

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A raging inferno. Bob descends the burning steps, stops in the hallway. Both he and Frozone carry several passed- out apartment dwellers on their shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIUS
dialogues.text: Is that everybody?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Yeah, that’s everyone! The building is beginning to COLLAPSE. They’re trapped with no way out. Frozone tries to ice the burning walls, but his ray is weak and ineffective. BOB (CONT’D) Can‘t you put this out? Lucius I can’t lay down a layer thick enough!! It's evaporating too fast!!

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: What? What’s that mean?

dialogues.speaker: LUCIUS
dialogues.text: Means it’s hot and I‘m dehydrated, Bob!

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: You're out of ICE                         You can’t run o ice! I thought you could use the water in the air! Lucius There IS NO water in this air! What's your excuse?? Run out of muscles?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: I can’t just go smashing through walls! The building’s getting weaker by the second! It’1l come down on top of us!! Lucius I wanted to go bowling!!! A large chunk of ceiling smashes to the floor in a burning heap. Bob looks around nervously, then fixes his gaze toward the door. He shifts his stack of unconscious victims to one shoulder and looks at Lucius. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Alright. Stay right on my tail, this is going to get hot! Bob begins a shout that gets louder as he runs into the burning hallway, Lucius a half-step behind him.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVELING WITH BOB
dialogues.text: as they race through the flames with their unconscious loads. Suddenly a BRICK WALL APPEARS. Bob picks up speed and lowers his free shoulder into it. The heroes and their rescued smash through the wall just as the building behind them collapses. Bob, Frozone and the pile of near-victims are saved. An ALARM sounds. Bob & Frozone realize they're--

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE A JEWELRY STORE
dialogues.text: A ROOKIE COP spies the MASKED MEN and draws his pistol. Frozone spies a WATER COOLER. He grabs a PAPER CUP.

dialogues.speaker: LUCIUS
dialogues.text: I'm thirsty. Lucius moves the cup under the tap. The jittery ROOKIE cocks his pistol’s hammer.

dialogues.speaker: ROOKIE COP
dialogues.text: I said FREEZE!

dialogues.speaker: LUCIUS
dialogues.text: I'm just getting a drink... His eyes fixed on the cop, Lucius slooowwwly brings the cup to his lips and drinks. His face becomes serene.

dialogues.speaker: ROOKIE COP
dialogues.text: Alright! You've had your drink! Now I want you to--

dialogues.speaker: LUCIUS
dialogues.text: I know, I know... Lucius drops the cup, raising his hands in front of him. LUCIUS (CONT’D) ..."freeze.” (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A frigid blast splits the air.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: 2 fire trucks and a police car screech, having arrived in front. Hearing the alarm, two VETERAN COPS bust into the~

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE JEWELRY STORE
dialogues.text: Drawing their guns, the COPS are stopped by a bewildering sight: --a recovering heap of rescued fire victims at the base ef an enormous hole in the wall. Standing watch over them is the ROOKIE, stunned and blinking under a layer of ice.

dialogues.speaker: A BACK ALLEYWAY
dialogues.text: Bob and Lucius jump into Lucius’s car, pulling off their ski masks.

dialogues.speaker: FROZONE
dialogues.text: That was way too close. We are not doing that again. They drive out of frame, REVEALING: a BLACK SPORTS CAR hidden in another alley behind. At the wheel is a beautiful, mysterious WOMAN with platinum blonde hair. She watches them drive off.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO
dialogues.text: Verify you want to switch targets? Over.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Trust me. This is the one he's been looking for...

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Bob enters quietly through the kitchen, pausing in the kitchen long enough to nab the remaining hunk of chocolate cake. Humming pleasantly as he chews, he moves into the living room when a voice comes out of the dark--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: You said you'd be back by eleven. Bob FREEZES. A light snaps ON. A chair swivels around-- it’s Helen, wearing her robe and a peeved expression.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: I said I'd be back later. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: I assumed you'd be back later. If you came back at all, you’d be “back later.”

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Well... I‘m back. Okay? Bob moves to go, but Helen’s left arm STRETCHES and stops him, plucking a small, dusty fragment of concrete off his coat. She crosses to him, catching up with her hand.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Is this... rubble?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (defensive) It was just a little workout, just to stay loose--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: You know how I feel about that, Bob! Darn you!! We just got settled! We can't blow cover again!!

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: --the building was coming down anyway--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Wha--? You KNOCKED DOWN A BUILDING??

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: It was on fire! Structurally unsound! It was coming down anyway!

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Tell me it’s not the police scanner again-

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: I performed a public service. You act like that’s a bad thing!

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: It is a bad thing, Bob!! Uprooting our family, again, because you had to relive the glory days is a very bad thing!!

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Hey, reliving the glory days is better than acting like they didn’t happen!!

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Yes! They happened. But this, our family, is what’s happening now, Bob! (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HELEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And you are missing this! I can’t believe you don’t want to go to your own son's graduation!

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: It's not a graduation! He’s moving from the fourth grade to the fifth grade!

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: It’s a ceremony...

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: It’s psychotic! They keep creating new ways to celebrate mediocrity, but if someone is genuinely exceptional, they shut him down because they don’t want everybody else to feel bad!

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: This is not about you, Bob!! This is about Dash!!

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: You wanna help Dash? Let him actually compete! Let him go out for sports!

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: I will not be made the enemy here!! You know why we can’t do thati!!

dialogues.speaker: THIS IS NOT ABOUT YOU
dialogues.text: An abrupt BREEZE ripples the air, ruffling some loose papers on the coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Alright, Dash. I know you're listening. Come on out.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: You too, young lady. Dash moves out from behind a door. Violet’s head REMATERIALIZES from behind the couch, she stands up, embarrassed. Bob moves next to Helen, becoming parental.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: It's okay, kids. We're just having a discussion.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Pretty loud discussion.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: But that’s okay. What’s important is that Mommy and I are always a team, always united... against... uh... (unsure where he’s going) +..the forces of--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Pigheadedness...?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: I was going to say evil or something.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: {to kids) We're sorry we woke you. Everything's okay. Go back to bed, it’s late. In fact-- {pointedly to Bob) ~-we should all be in bed. Bob frowns and turns away, following the kids back toward the bedrooms. INSURICARE - BOB’S CUBICLE ~ FOLLOWING MORNING Bob sits at his tiny desk. One look at his bleary face says it all: he hasn’t slept all night. His intercom BEEPS. Bob glares at it a beat, then hits ANSWER.

dialogues.speaker: INTERCOM
dialogues.text: Mr. Huph wants you in his office.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: INTERCOM
dialogues.text: Now. Bob releases the intercom button, SIGHS. Mirage looks around Bob’s cramped cubicle, her gaze falling to the open briefcase on Bob's desk. INSIDE HUPH’S OFFICE Marginally bigger than Bob’s office, with a coveted window to the outside world. Painfully clean and joyless. Every pencil sharpened, every paper perfectly stacked and aligned to run parallel to the edge of the desktop. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HUPH
dialogues.text: Sit down, Bob. (Bob sits) I’m not happy, Bob. Not. Happy. Ask me why. Huph rises from his desk and crosses to Bob.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Okay. Why.

dialogues.speaker: HUPH
dialogues.text: Why what? Be specific, Bob. Bob’s eyes are drawn to the window: Outside, across the street, a stocky man lingers suspiciously in an alleyway.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (still watching man) Why are you unhappy.

dialogues.speaker: HUPH
dialogues.text: Your customers make me unhappy.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (turns back to Huph} You've gotten complaints?

dialogues.speaker: HUPH
dialogues.text: Complaints I can handle. What I can’t handle is your customers’ inexplicable knowledge of Insuricare’s inner workings. They’re experts! Experts, Bob! Exploiting every loophole, dodging every obstacle-- (aghast) --they’re penetrating the bureaucracy!

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Did I do something illegal?

dialogues.speaker: HUPH
dialogues.text: (irked) No...

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Are you saying we shouldn’t help our customers?

dialogues.speaker: HUPH
dialogues.text: The law requires that I answer no.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: We're supposed to help people. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HUPH
dialogues.text: We're supposed to help OUR people! Starting with our stockholders, Bob. Who's helping them out, huh? Huph draws a calming breath, affects a statesmanlike air.

dialogues.speaker: HUPH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know, Bob... a company is--

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Like an enormous clock.

dialogues.speaker: HUPH
dialogues.text: ~-like an enormous cl-- Yes! Precisely. it only works if all the little cogs mesh together. Bob's attention returns to the window: the stocky man is accosting a smaller one. Like an ATTACK DOG, Bob is suddenly ALERT; every muscle tensed and ready-~

dialogues.speaker: HUPH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Now, a clock needs to be clean, well- lubricated, wound tight. The best clocks have jewel movements, cogs that fit, that cooperate by design. I’m being metaphorical, Bob. You know what I mean by cooperative cogs? Bob? Bob...? Huph follows Bob’s gaze to the window. On the street, the iarger man clubs the smaller man with a mace. He crumples to the sidewalk. Huph jerks Bob’s face back toward his-~

dialogues.speaker: HUPH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look at me when I’m talking to you, Parr!

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (pointing) That man out there-- he needs help!

dialogues.speaker: HUPH
dialogues.text: Do NOT change the subject, Bob! We're discussing your attitude!

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: But he’s getting mugged!

dialogues.speaker: HUPH
dialogues.text: Well, let’s hope we don’t cover him! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (heading for the door) I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: HUPH
dialogues.text: Stop RIGHT NOW OR YOU’RE FIRED! Bob HESITATES, his hand on the knob of the opened door, fighting back the very core of his being. Huph narrows his eyes, speaking softly...

dialogues.speaker: HUPH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Close the door... Neck cords STRAINING, Bob slowly shuts the door. He releases the knob, which he's crumpled in rage.

dialogues.speaker: HUPH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get over here... now. Bob resumes his position in front of Huph, but his gaze inevitably returns to the scene outside the window. BOB’S P.0.V. The MUGGER pockets his plunder and runs off, leaving his victim dazed and helpless on the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (seething) He got away...

dialogues.speaker: HUPH
dialogues.text: Good thing, too. You were this close to losing your j-- Huph SQUEAKS as Bob’s enormous right hand flashes out and clamps around his neck--

dialogues.speaker: OUTER HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Huph’s body BURSTS THROUGH A WALL and into another adjacent, tumbling face down onto a copy machine. It begins to spit out multiple copies of his pressed face. Huph has in fact gone through several walls, four in total and three adjoining offices, before skidding across the floor of the newly visible hallway beyond. The occupants of adjacent offices lean into view, gawking in astonishment through their shattered walls; first at Huph’s sprawled form, then one by one back at Bob. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Uh oh...

dialogues.speaker: HOSPITAL
dialogues.text: Through the window in the door we can glimpse Huph in a full body cast. Bob, seated on a bench outside, looks up as RICK DICKER, a haggard-faced man in a black suit and tie quietly exits Huph’s room. He stops, looks at Bob, then turns away, heading to the elevator. Bob follows after him.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: How is he?

dialogues.speaker: DICKER
dialogues.text: He’1l live.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: I'm fired, aren't I?

dialogues.speaker: DICKER
dialogues.text: You think?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: What can I say, Rick?

dialogues.speaker: DICKER
dialogues.text: Nothing you haven't said before.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Someone was in trouble...

dialogues.speaker: DICKER
dialogues.text: Someone’s always in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: I had to do something...

dialogues.speaker: DICKER
dialogues.text: Yeah. Every time you say those words, it means @ month and a half of trouble for me, Bob. Minimum. It means hundreds of thousands of taxpayer dollars...

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: IT know.

dialogues.speaker: DICKER
dialogues.text: We gotta pay to keep the company quiet. We gotta pay damages, erase memories, relocate your family. Every time it gets harder. Money money money. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DICKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We can‘t keep doing this, Bob. We appreciate what you did in the old days, but those days are over. From now on, you're on your own. The elevator doors OPEN, Dicker steps inside. Bob stares at the floor, beaten. Dicker looks at him with pity. Then

dialogues.speaker: DICKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Listen, Bob... maybe I could relocate you, for old times’ sake...

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: No. I can’t do that to my family again. We just got settled. It'll be alright. I’1ll make it work. Thanks. Dicker stares at Bob a long moment. A bittersweet smile--

dialogues.speaker: DICKER
dialogues.text: Take care of yourself. The elevator doors CLOSE. Bob stares at them, numb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob climbs out of his car and is surprised to find someone watching him-- --the KID on the Big Wheel, waiting in exactly the same spot as the night before.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: What‘re you waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: I dunno. Something amazing, I guess. A rueful smile biooms and dies on Bob’s face.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Me too, kid. Me too. INT. BOB‘S DEN A cramped, windowless museum of MR. INCREDIBLE arcana. Walls and shelves cluttered with mementos of his storied past: framed photos, newspaper front pages, magazines, and, displayed on the wall under Plexiglas, his MR. INCREDIBLE SUIT. Bob enters and closes the door. He opens his briefcase, pulls out an INSURICARE EMPLOYEE‘S MANUAL. Bob growls and rips it in half, tossing it in the trashcan.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: On a roll now, he begins to dump the entire contents of his briefcase into the trash when-- CLUNK! Bob DOUBLE-TAKES-- startled by the HEAVY sound. He peers over the edge of the desk, into the trash, and SEES-- A LARGE MANILA ENVELOPE. He picks it up, and is surprised it's heavy. He opens it and pulls out a FLAT PANEL about a half-inch thick. On it is printed “THIS END UP”. He turns the panel as instructed. In the center is a small circle with writing beneath it. Bob SQUINTS, unable to read the tiny letters. He brings it closer--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the letters... slowly... come... into... focus:

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (reading) HOLD STILL. Suddenly, the panel projects a red GRID over Bob’s face. We hear a robotic female VOICE--

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Match: Mr. Incredible. Bob DROPS the panel in surprise. It clatters to the desk, still functioning. A small foot-long rod with a metal ball at the top pops out from the panel. The ball at the tip makes a quick, single revolution, scanning the surrounding room with a vertical beam.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Room is secure. Commence message. The panel FLICKERS. It’s a VIDEO SCREEN. An IMAGE appears; the beautiful platinum blonde woman who visited Bob’s office earlier that day.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Hello, Mr. Incredible. My name is Mirage. Yes, we know who you are. Rest assured your secret is safe with us. Actually, we have something in common. According to the Government, neither of us exist. Please pay attention as this message is CLASSIFIED and will not be repeated... Bob moves closer, mesmerized... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MIRAGE
dialogues.text: I represent a top-secret division of the Government, designing and testing experimental technology and-- we have need of your unique abilities.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Honey?? Bob startles, then strains to listen to the message. MIRAGE (CONT’D) BOB Something has happened at What?? our remote testing facility. MIRAGE (CONT’D) HELEN'S VOICE A highly experimental Dinner‘s ready! prototype robot has escaped our control-~ MIRAGE (CONT’D) BOB Although it is contained OKAY, okay! within an isolated area-- Bob grabs a pen and a scrap of paper and starts to scribble furiously, only to find the pen dry. Cursing, he rummages for a working pen, finds one and begins to take notes.

dialogues.speaker: MIRAGE
dialogues.text: ~--it threatens to cause incalculable damage to itself and to our facilities, jeopardizing hundreds of millions of dollars’ worth of equipment and research. Only someone with-- HELEN’S VOICE MIRAGE (CONT’D) Is someone in there? --your unique abilities can contain the robot without completely destroying it.

dialogues.speaker: BOB MIRAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The T.V.! I’m trying to Because of its highly watch--! sensitive nature-- HELEN’S VOICE MIRAGE (CONT'D) Well, stop trying, it’s ~-this mission does not, time for dinner! nor will it ever, exist.

dialogues.speaker: BOB MIRAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ONE MINUTE! If you accept, your payment will be equivalent to your current annual salary. Bob’s jaw goes slack. He scribbles “BIG $”.

dialogues.speaker: MIRAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Call the number on the screen. Voice matching will be used to insure security. The Supers aren't gone, Mr. incredible. You’re still here. You can still do great things. Or... you can listen to Police Scanners. Your choice. You have 24 hours to respond. Think about it. Bob finishes scribbling. His mind is reeling. HEROIC MUSIC begins to stir. A new light comes into Bob’s eyes as they turn to the--

dialogues.speaker: PICTURES ON THE WALL
dialogues.text: of Mr. Incredible’s gallant past. The robotic voice relays a last message--

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: This message will self-destruct. Bob‘s eyes fall to the panel. Uh oh. HALLWAY OUTSIDE BOB’S DEN We hear a muffled BOOM from inside. After a long beat the ceiling sprinklers come on, followed by the family’s SHOUTS from the dining room. The den door opens and Bob emerges in a cloud of smoke, so preoccupied that he's slow to notice the downpour.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: Bob and Helen finish drying the inside of the house.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: You're one distracted guy.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Hmn...? Am I? Don’t mean to be. Helen looks at Bob, puts a tender arm around him.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: I know you miss being a hero... and your job is frustrating and... and I just want you to know how much it means to me that you stay at it anyway.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Honey... about the job...

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: I-I... uh... something's happened-- Helen glares at him, clearly expecting the worst.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Whaaat?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: The company’s sending me to a conference out of town. I’1l be gone for a few days.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: A conference? They've never sent you to a conference before. Helen gives Bob a questioning look. Bob tenses. Pause. HELEN (CONT’D) This is good, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: You see? They’re finally recognizing your talents. You're moving up...! (she hugs him, then, softly) It’s wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes, it is...

dialogues.speaker: BOB'S DEN
dialogues.text: Bob is on the phone, glancing at the MR. INCREDIBLE SUIT in his display case. After a ring, a female voice answers BOB (CONT’D) This is Mr. Incredible. I’m in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sleek-looking MANTA JET slices the sky.
Bob, clad in his old (and now too-tight) Mr. Incredible suit. MIRAGE IS ON BOARD. SHE DEBRIEFS HIM.

dialogues.speaker: MIRAGE
dialogues.text: The OMNIDROID 9000 is a top-secret, prototype battle robot. Its artificial intelligence enables it to solve any problem it’s confronted with. And... unfortunately--

dialogues.speaker: MR. INCREDIBLE
dialogues.text: Let me guess. It got smart enough to wonder why it had to take orders.

dialogues.speaker: MIRAGE
dialogues.text: (nodding) --we lost control. And now it’s loose in the jungle, threatening our facility. We've had to evacuate all personnel from the island for their own safety. They’re waiting offshore for the all clear.

dialogues.speaker: MR. INCREDIBLE
dialogues.text: How am I going in?

dialogues.speaker: MIRAGE
dialogues.text: The Omnidroid’s defenses have necessitated an air drop from 5000 feet. Its cloaking device makes it difficult to track... although we're pretty sure it’s on the southern half of the island. One more thing; obviously it represents a significant investment--

dialogues.speaker: MR. INCREDIBLE
dialogues.text: You want me to shut it down without completely destroying it.

dialogues.speaker: MIRAGE
dialogues.text: (smiles) You are Mr. Incredible.

dialogues.speaker: DROP POD BAY
dialogues.text: After a few unsuccessful tries, Mr. Incredible manages to squeeze his girth into the pod. Mirage enters the pod bay, presses the pod's speaker switch. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MIRAGE
dialogues.text: (through speaker) Remember: it's a learning robot. Every moment you spend fighting it only increases its knowledge of how to beat you.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (through speaker) Shut it down. Do it quickly. Don’t destroy it.

dialogues.speaker: MIRAGE
dialogues.text: {through speaker) And don‘t die. Bob shoots Mirage a wan smile.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Great. Thanks. The POD is blasted from the jet and disappears into clouds above the island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob groans as he tries to disengage his generous belly from the tiny pod. Finally, with a frustrated yell, he RIPS the pod in half; FREE. He stretches, does a few toe touches and twists to shake out the kinks. He’s ready.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Showtime. He jogs off into the jungle to track the robot.

dialogues.speaker: A SERIES OF DISSOLVES
dialogues.text: As an out-of-shape Bob jogs deeper and deeper into the jungle, growing more winded with each passing mile. His sides ache, and he PAUSES now and then to catch his breath, but he shakes it off and resumes his pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: The forest is still now, and Bob’s footfalls and heavy breathing are the only sounds we hear. Bob still scans the jungle, but he’s tiring and he pauses to lean against a banyan tree to catch his breath... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: .--and notices LARGE SLASH MARKS in the side of the tree. He runs his hand over them; they’re fresh. In the dirt near his feet is a giant K-SHAPED FOOTPRINT.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Hn... With a loud CRACK the trees behind him split apart and the OMNIDROID is upon him. It SLASHES at him and he dodges, but not quickly enough and the bot’s claw catches him in the shoulder, drawing blood. Fire comes into Bob's eyes and when the bot slashes again he’s ready-~ leaping over the bot and landing on his feet on the opposite side. The bot is caught by surprise and in the split second it takes for the bot to find Bob-- --BAMMMM!!! Bob has thrown a mammoth punch that sends the machine flying into the nearest tree. Bob lets out a happy snarl that says, “You just got schooled by MR. INCREDIBLE, baby.” Deep within its metal shell, servos WHINE and the bot rights itself, its EYE LENS fixing on Bob.

dialogues.speaker: BOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Uh oh. The bot CHARGES. Once again Bob tries his patented leap-- TIME SLOWS as we cut to INSIDE THE BOT’S BRAIN. A VIEWSCREEN shows the arc of Bob’s leap being calculated by the bot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bot swings-- SWATTING Bob mid-jump. Bob sails into a banyan tree so hard that it splits the trunk. Bob is STUNNED: the bot has quickly learned and countered. The bot CHARGES again.

dialogues.speaker: WITH BOB
dialogues.text: ~-as he runs for his life, the Omnidroid hot on his tail. Bob races through the jungle with surprising speed, but his added weight is slowing him down. He CUTS hard to his right and DIVES--

dialogues.speaker: OFF A CLIFF
dialogues.text: Bob tumbles and slides down the rocky, near-vertical face, followed by the relentless machine. It ROLLS past him and lands in his path. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bob flings boulders at the machine, but the bot is a fast learner, immediately incorporating Bob's moves into its own attack. The Omnidroid leaps high in the air and nearly lands on top of Bob, who leaps clear and tumbles to the bottom of the cliffs.

dialogues.speaker: LAVA FIELDS
dialogues.text: Bob REELS, and before he knows what’s happening, the Omnidroid is there, driving him toward the bubbling-hot pools of LAVA. Bob resists the bot with all his might, but his feet can't hold the rocky surface, and as he is pushed ever closer to the white-hot lava, fear begins to grip his mind. Bob and the Omnidroid grip each other like wildly mismatched wrestlers, with Bob at lava’s edge now, losing ground. Bob is STRAINING, desperate... then something in him SNAPS. He fills with rage, and with a ROAR he-- ~-jerks to one side and FLIPS the OMNIDROID into the lava. The machine hits the lava with a hissy SPLAT, sinks into the hot glow and disappears. Bob is wild. He laughs, pointing at the bot’s grave with a gesture of defiance and-- SNAP!-~ throws his back out. Suddenly he can’t breathe.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Agh. My back--! The ground EXPLODES beneath him, splitting the rock. Claws rise from the lava, grip the rock, and the dreaded Omnidroid draws itself out of the lava, dripping magma, its metal body glowing red as if it came from hell itself. Bob looks down. The ground is splitting into chunks beneath his feet. In pain, barely able to move, Bob makes a desperate leap to a chunk of rock as it breaks free... and lands pathetically on top. The bot snatches him off and slams him into the ground. Then it lifts Bob up, grabbing his feet with another claw and begins to pull Bob apart. Bob strains, then-- POP! --his back realigns! Bob is a new man! With a laugh he jackknifes-- ripping off one of the Omnidroid’s claws. He drops underneath the bot, causing the bot to open a second eye in its underbelly to find him. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bob ROARS, seizing the second eye, ripping it off the bot‘s body and flinging it in the lava pool. Before the bot can react, Bob has climbed inside the hole in the belly. The bot knows Bob is inside and begins to STAB itself wildly to get at him... puncturing itseif again and again and tearing itself apart. Until... sparking and sputtering, it staggers and shuts down. Bob punches a hole in the top, whistling and slapping its side. The bot drunkenly ROUSES and makes a final grab for Bob deep within its belly, and rips out its own metallic guts... ...and KEELS OVER, a lifeless scrap pile. Bob hops out, smiling. Mr. Incredible‘s work is done.

dialogues.speaker: IN A NEARBY TREE
dialogues.text: An exotic BIRD, which looks strangely out of place, cocks its head to one side. CAMERA PUSHES IN to one of its eyes as a metal IRIS appears. It’s a CAMERA LENS.

dialogues.speaker: A SHADOWED FIGURE
dialogues.text: stands with Mirage, watching this all on a bank of VIDEO SCREENS .

dialogues.speaker: SHADOWED FIGURE
dialogues.text: Surprising. We must bring him back. Sound the all clear. (he exits, stops, turns back) And... invite him to dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TRANSPOD arrives and Bob steps out, dressed in a tux.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob opens the door, peeks inside. The hall is massive, with an open terrace that overlooks the tropical forest. In the center of the room is an enormous dining table, placed parallel to a fall of hot LAVA. Bob checks his watch; realizes he’s early. A sudden RUMBLE makes him look up. The LAVA FALL PARTS, revealing a SECRET PASSAGEWAY. MIRAGE emerges. Bob instinctively pulls back, leaving the door opened just enough to watch. A SILHOUETTED FIGURE follows after Mirage, gesturing animatedly. They pause at the entrance to the passageway, their talk too distant to be heard. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A sound causes MIRAGE to look in Bob’s direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mirage, suspicious, pushes open the dining hall DOORS. Climbing out of the transpod, Bob notices her and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Am I overdressed?

dialogues.speaker: MIRAGE
dialogues.text: Actually, you leok rather dashing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob and Mirage are seated at an enormous table that runs parallel to an equally large LAVA FALL.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: I take it our host is--

dialogues.speaker: MIRAGE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. He’s not able to dine with us tonight. He hopes you'll understand.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Of course. I usually make it a point to know who I’m working for.

dialogues.speaker: MIRAGE
dialogues.text: He prefers a certain amount of anonymity. Surely you of all people understand that.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: I was just wondering... of all the places to settle down, why live--

dialogues.speaker: MIRAGE
dialogues.text: --with a volcano? He’s attracted to power. So am I. It’s a weakness we share.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Seems a bit unstable.

dialogues.speaker: MIRAGE
dialogues.text: I prefer to think of it as misunderstood.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Aren’'t we all? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MIRAGE
dialogues.text: Volcanic soil is among the most fertile on earth. Everything at the table was grown right here. How does it compare?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Everything's delicious. Bob raises his glass. Mirage smiles and does likewise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His self-esteem back, Bob returns home with renewed vigor. He bonds with his kids, gets frisky with Helen, and takes new pride in his appearance. He buys a new snazzy SPORTS CAR for himself, and a new car for Helen. After he says goodbye to Helen several mornings, clearly pretending to go off to the job he no longer holds at Insuricare, we see how he’s actually spending his days; dropping weight and getting in shape. The Superheroic workouts do their job; Bob is in the best shape he’s been in many years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob, dressed in a more expensive and tailored version of his Insuricare suit, pauses to examine the torn spot on his MR. INCREDIBLE SUPERSUIT.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hurry, honey, or you'll be late for work! Bob quickly stuffs his SUPERSUIT into his briefcase and snaps it shut.

dialogues.speaker: PARR HOUSE
dialogues.text: Bob pauses at the doorstep. Helen enters and HUGS him.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Have a great day, honey! Help customers, climb ladders--

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: --bring bacon--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: --all that jazz! Helen plants a proud kiss on his lips. Bob exits.  52. EXT. E’S HOUSE - DAY Bob's new car pulls up to an imposing gate, a futuristic web of parallel laser beams. He turns toward a video screen and presses a button beneath it. The VIDEO SCREEN lights up, revealing a BURLY GUARD.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Do you have an appointment?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: I’m an old friend, I just wanted--

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: All visitors are required to make arr-- The GUARD suddenly flinches from something below camera, and is shooed offscreen by a strident, husky female voice

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Get back, Rolf! Go check the electric fence or something. A pair of huge glasses fronting the top half of a head rises into the bottom half of the screen, out of focus. This is EDNA MODE, known by her friends simply as “E.”

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: What is it? What do you want?? Bob removes his sunglasses and grins at the camera.

dialogues.speaker: E, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My God, you’ve gotten fat. Come in! Come! The gate opens and Bob drives up the long driveway that winds up the hill to E’s tastefully arty house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: E leads Bob through the tasteful, minimalistic entrance way into her massive living room. E is in her early sixties, half German, half Japanese, and like both of those small countries, not to be underestimated.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: Yes, things are going quite well. My God, no complaints. But, you know, it is not the same. Not the same at all.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Weren’t you just in the news? Some show in Prague? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: Milan, darling, Milan. “Supermodels”-— HAH! Nothing super about them. Spoiled, stupid little stick figures with poofy lips who think only about themselves-— FEH! I used to design for Gods! But perhaps you come with a challenge, eh? I was surprised to get your call.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: E, I just need a patch job. Bob hands E his damaged suit. She examines it, frowning.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: This is megamesh, outmoded but very sturdy, and you've torn right through it. What have you been doing, Robert? Moon- lighting hero work?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Must've happened a long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: (knowingly) I see. (re: his suit) This is a hobo suit, you can’t be seen in this. I won’t allow it. Fifteen years ago, maybe. But now... E drops the suit into a trashcan. Bob retrieves it.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: What do you mean? You designed it.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: I never look back, darling. It distracts from the now. You need a new suit. That much is certain.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: A new suit? Where the hell would I get--

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: You can’t! It’s impossible, I'm far too busy so ask me now, before I again become sane.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (confused) You... want to make me a suit?

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: You push too hard, darling-- but I accept. It will be bold. Dramatic! Heroic!

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Yeah. Something classic, like Dynaguy. He had a great look. The cape, the boots-—-

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: No capes.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Isn't that my decision? Unaccustomed to being questioned, E visibly STIFFENS.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: Do you remember... Thunderhead?

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: --beefy and B-movie handsome, decked out in a splendid outfit with elegant floor-length CAPE.

dialogues.speaker: E, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Tall, storm powers, nice man. Good with kids...

dialogues.speaker: RESUME SCENE
dialogues.text: Bob knows where this is headed and moves to speak, but is instantly cut off by E.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: September 15th of fifty-eight--

dialogues.speaker: RESUME FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: A MADMAN aims a MISSILE LAUNCHER at a city across a bay. Maelstrom leaps into frame, dispatches him with a single punch and turns the missile towards the open sea. His duty done, he turns and smiles at a young lady standing nearby, failing to notice that his cape has caught on the missile-- E (v.0.) ~-all was well, another day saved, when-- The rocket BLASTS into the distance, taking Maelstrom with it-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: E (V.0.} (CONT’D) -- his cape snagged on a missile fin. His scorched remains were found several hundred miles away~- INTERCUT: comically brief FLASHBACKS (as E describes them) of each Super being doomed by his or her cape--

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Maelstrom wasn’t the brightest bulb in th-

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: (cuts him off) --SLIPSTREAM: April 19th, fifty-seven. Cape caught in a jet turbine--

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: E, you can’t generalize about these th-~

dialogues.speaker: E, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (rapid-fire FLASHBACKS) ~~MULTIMAN: express elevator, DYNAGUY: snag on takeoff, SPLASHDOWN: sucked into a vortex-— END FLASHBACKS. E glares at Bob, declaring with unassailable finality: E (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: --NO CAPES
dialogues.text: (turns, exiting dismissively) Well, go on. Your new suit will be finished before your next assignment.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: You know I’m retired from hero work.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: As am I, Robert. Yet here we are.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: I only need a patch job, E. For sentimental reasons.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: (heavy sigh, takes suit) Fine. I will also fix the hobo suit.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: E, you’re the best of the best.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: Yes, I know, darling. I know.  56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen plucks one of Bob’s enormous shirts from a stack of freshly cleaned laundry and hangs it up in their closet, when something catches her eye: A long, PLATINUM-BLONDE HAIR (Mirage’s) on Bob’s suit jacket. Helen plucks it off, examining it. The phone RINGS. She goes to answer it, hesitating when she hears--

dialogues.speaker: BOB, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I got it! Don’t answer it, honey, I got it! Helen frowns. There’s something suspicious about Bob’s eagerness. INT. BOB’S DEN Bob picks up the phone~~

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: MIRAGE
dialogues.text: We have a new assignment for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She carefully picks up the phone, places a hand over the Mouthpiece, and listens in...

dialogues.speaker: MIRAGE'S VOICE, (PHONE)
dialogues.text: How soon can you get here? BOB‘S VOICE (PHONE) I‘ll leave tomorrow morning. Helen REACTS. INT. BOB’S DEN

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: I understand. Goodbye. Bob hangs up the phone and moves to the door, opening it. Helen is there, blocking the doorway. She forces a smile.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Who was that, honey? The office? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Another conference. Short notice, but-- (smiles, shrugs) ~-duty calls. Bob squeezes past her and exits. Helen stares into his den, feeling suspicious and impotent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob is seated in his new sports car, its engine purring. He belts himself in. Helen enters, still in her robe.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Bob=—

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Hmn? What is it, honey? A storm of conflicting emotions play across Helen‘s face. But she puts on a happy face and leans down through his open window.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Have a nice trip.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Thanks, honey. Call you when I land.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: I love you... so much. Something in her voice makes Bob hesitate. He looks back at her, curious.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: I love you too. He gives her a kiss, then backs out of the driveway, and, with a wave, drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sleek-looking MANTA JET slices the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob, leaner and meaner in his new SUPERSUIT, dips a fresh prawn into some cocktail sauce and gazes around the luxurious cabin. He’s happy as a clam. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: AUTOPILOT
dialogues.text: This is your automated Captain speaking. Would you care for more Mimosa?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Don’t mind if I do. Thanks. His glass disappears into his armrest, instantly replaced by a full glass of mimosa.

dialogues.speaker: AUTOPILOT
dialogues.text: You‘re welcome. Currently 78 degrees in Nomanisan. Please fasten your seat belts. We’re beginning our descent.

dialogues.speaker: OVER THE ISLAND
dialogues.text: As the jet begins its descent toward the island, we begin to see its spectacular aspects: active volcano, towering snow-capped peak, tumbling waterfalls, futuristic monorail, etc.... a paradise on earth. Suddenly the engines cut off and the jet PLUNGES, nose down, into the sea, converting into a SUBMERSIBLE. BENEATH THE WATER’S SURFACE The jetsub cruises through a fantastic seascape of exotic otherworldly rock formations, toward the base of the island through vast curtains of bubbles created from a field of cooling lava. A massive door OPENS, revealing a huge underwater docking bay. The ship enters, the entrance closing behind them.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE DOCKING BAY
dialogues.text: The water DRAINS. The JETSUB settles to a landing. A giant DOCKING TUBE extends from a side wall and connects to the side of the jetsub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob turns as a door opens, REVEALING a small side chamber and a pair of shapely LEGS. MIRAGE leans into view.

dialogues.speaker: MIRAGE
dialogues.text: Welcome back, Mr. Incredible. Nice suit. You've lost weight.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: But not my appetite. It‘s good to be back. Mirage. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bob enters the monopod. The doors shut and it takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MONOPOD zooms along a track which rises from a tunnel beneath the lagoon and sweeps through the jungle. Although this is his second time here, Bob is seeing the island with new eyes. It is a WONDER. The monopod track disappears straight into a rushing WATERFALL. Suddenly the waterfall PARTS, the water separating like an enormously long chiffon curtain, revealing the intricately designed architecture hidden underneath.

dialogues.speaker: WITH THE POD
dialogues.text: as it enters a VERTICAL TUBE, and ZOOMS upward into the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elevator doors slide open crisply. Bob enters and takes in the room. It is small, open and tasteful, with a balcony overlooking a breathtaking view of the jungle and the ocean beyond.

dialogues.speaker: MIRAGE
dialogues.text: You will be briefed about your next assignment in conference room at two. Room A113.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Two o'clock. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: MIRAGE
dialogues.text: See you there. Mirage leaves. Bob enters, throwing his case on the bed. He grabs a pear from a bowl of fresh fruit and takes a bite. He steps out on his balcony and leans against the railing. He could get used to paradise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen vacuums. She notices some debris outside Bob’s den, and vacuums it. The vacuum bumps the door and it swings open. Helen stares at the floor, pushes the vacuum forward in a probe of Bob’s den carpet. The sound of filthy debris rattles up the vacuum tube. Helen SIGHS: she’s got to vacuum the entire room.  60 INT. BOB‘S DEN - CONTINUOUS As she begins to vacuum the den floor, she notices that the door of his Mr. Incredible suit display case is AJAR. She pushes it closed and suddenly STOPS, looking closer at Bob’s old SUPERSUIT-~ ~-and sees a new rip, expertly and recognizably mended.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Edna.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Hello? I’d like to speak to Edna.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: This is Edna.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: E? This is Helen.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: Helen who?

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Helen Parr-- er, uh... you know... Elastigirl.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: DARLING! How ARE you?? How divine to hear from you!

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Yes, it has been a while. Listen, there’s only one person Bob would trust to patch his Supersuit, and that’s YOU, E.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: Yes yes yes. Marvelous, isn’t it? Much better than those horrible pajamas he used to wear. They are all finished, when are you coming to see? Don’t make me beg, darling, I won‘’t do it, you know!

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Beg... uh-~? No, I’m calling abeg about-~ suit-- about suit... Bob sssuit--- (frustrated with herself) -~-I’m calling about Bob’s suit! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: You come in one hour, darling. I insist. Okay? Okay, bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob opens the door. No one is there. He checks the wall clock: two o’clock. He decides to enter and takes a seat at the meeting table. There are some strange, low sounds. hen the far wall SLIDES OPEN, revealing the outdoors and~ --a bigger, badder OMNIDROID. Bob turns to run, but the OMNIDROID is fast. It grabs him and flings him into the outside air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob SAILS to the edge of the jungle, landing with a thud. Before he can react, the robot has him again, and slams him into the ground. A VOICE comes over a loudspeaker.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: It’s BIGGER! It's BADDER! The robot seizes Bob in one giant claw, turning two others into WHIRLING BLADES. They close in on Bob’s neck- --when a young, chunky, wild-haired man in a bright Supersuit descends from the sky on jet-boots, landing on top of the enormous robot.

dialogues.speaker: WILD-HAIRED MAN
dialogues.text: It’s too much for Mr. Incredible! It’s finally ready! The wild-haired man pokes a few buttons on one of his wristbands. The robot’s BLADES stop, the bot stands down.

dialogues.speaker: WILD-HAIRED MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I went through quite a few Supers to gel it worthy to fight you, but, man... it wasn't good enough! After you trashed the last one I had to make some major modifications. Sure it was difficult, but you are worth it. After all... I’m your biggest fan. A dark realization falls over Bob’s face...

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Buddy...? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: My name’s not BUDDY! He presses a button on one of the thick platinum BANDS around his wrists: the OMNIDROID FLINGS Bob again.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And it‘s not “IncrediBoy” either. That ship has sailed. All I wanted was to help you. I only wanted to help! And what did you say to me??

dialogues.speaker: PLASHBACK
dialogues.text: A shot from the prologue, softened by memory. A young Mr. Incredible turns away from Buddy/IncrediBoy.

dialogues.speaker: MR. INCREDIBLE
dialogues.text: Go home, Buddy. I work alone.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Still in his IncrediBoy costume, but without the mask, Buddy glowers up at his bedroom wall, a shrine to Mr. Incredible. He tears a poster off the wall.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It tore me apart. But you taught me an important lesson: you can’t count on anyone...

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: ...especially your heroes.

dialogues.speaker: MR. INCREDIBLE
dialogues.text: I was wrong to treat you that way. I‘m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: See? Now you respect me. Because I'ma threat. That’s the way it works. Turns out, there are a lot of people, whole countries who want respect. And they will pay through the nose to get it. How do you think I got rich? I invented weapons. Now I have a weapon that only I can defeat, and when I unleash it I’1ll get-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bob suddenly FLINGS the LOG at Buddy. He DUCKS it, and presses a button on one of his WRISTBANDS: a BEAM erupts from his index finger and HITS Bob in his chest, FREEZING him mid-action. Buddy CHUCKLES with admiration.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You sly dog! You got me moncloguing! Buddy jerks his beam-arm to his right, effortlessly hurling Bob into a tree with tremendous force.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cool, huh?? Zero-point energy. I save the best inventions for myself!! Buddy immediately catches Bob in the IMMOBI-RAY again, freezing him in space. BUDDY (CONT’D) Look at THAT! Am I good enough now? (slams Bob into ground)

dialogues.speaker: WHO'S SUPER NOW
dialogues.text: (slams Bob again) I’m SYNDROME! Your nemesis! And-- Syndrome realizes he’s lost Bob, inadvertently flinging him over the trees.

dialogues.speaker: SYNDROME
dialogues.text: Brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: JUNGLE CLIFFS
dialogues.text: Bob's body arcs over the treetops, dropping into a deep river that flows into a waterfall. He pulls himself onto a rock. Syndrome becomes visible over the distant trees. He spies Bob and rockets toward him Bob takes a running leap off the rock, over the falls, and disappears into the mists below.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BASE OF THE FALLS
dialogues.text: Bob hits the water in an explosion of bubbles.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE TOP OF THE FALLS
dialogues.text: Syndrome lands on the rock. Pulls a tiny electronic DEVICE from his wristband. He hits the primer. The device begins to BEEP.

dialogues.speaker: SYNDROME
dialogues.text: Try one of these on for size, big boy.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He drops the device over the falls.

dialogues.speaker: THE BASE OF THE FALLS
dialogues.text: Bob’s eyes widen when he sees the device entering the water. He turns and swims as fast as he can for the nearest protection: a hole in the rocks. The device

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ~-blowing BOB through the hole so fast that--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is BLOWN into the inside of a cave. Bob COUGHS up some water, tries to catch his breath. He looks up to see-- --a skeletal FACE. He jumps back in surprise. It is the remains of a MAN, his only clothes the ragged remnants of shoulder pads, boots, and an odd-looking HELMET. Bob crawls over to rub some dirt from the emblem over the eyes: the emblem reads “G B”.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Gazerbeam... The skeleton is still sitting up, and Bob is compelled to follow its gaze to the adjacent cave wall. There... presumably in his dying moments, Gazerbeam had burned a word into the rock: “KRONOS”.

dialogues.speaker: BOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kronos...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then Bob hears a sound near the blowhole of the cave. A tiny, flying PROBE rises from the hole. A scanner detects a body in the cave, and the probe flies toward it. It pauses in front of the skeleton, scans it, then retreats, exiting. Bob slowly rises from behind the skeletal remains and watches it go.

dialogues.speaker: JUNGLE
dialogues.text: Syndrome’s PROBE emerges from the mist of the falls and returns to Syndrome. It BEEPS as it DOCKS with his wristband.

dialogues.speaker: PROBE
dialogues.text: Life readings negative. Mr. Incredible terminated. Syndrome BOWS his head in respect to his former idol. INSIDE E’S HOUSE - DAY E leads Helen downstairs toward her hidden lab.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: This project has completely confiscated my life, darling... consumed me as only hero work can. My best work, I must admit. Simple. Elegant, yet bold. You will die. I did Robert’s suit and it turned out so beautiful I just had to continue!

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: E, it’s great to see you, but-- I have no idea what you're talking about, I just--

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: Yes, words are useless. Gobble gobble gobble-~ there’s too much of it, darling, too much! That is why I show you my work. That is why you are here! She turns to the wall and rapidly executes an elaborate series of security measures: punches a fifteen-digit code with her left hand, while-~ pressing her right hand against a panel. It FLASHES, as-- she exposes her eyes to a RETINAL SCAN which--~ causes a MICROPHONE to extend from the wall to her lips-- E (CONT’D) (into microphone) Edna... Mode. IN A FLASH: a CEILING PANEL OPENS, and out pops an ENORMOUS GUN, which trains its sights on Helen. E sees this, turns back to the microphone, adding hastily--

dialogues.speaker: E, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And “guest.” The gun retreats into the ceiling. The wall in front of them OPENS dramatically, REVEALING:  66

dialogues.speaker: E'S TESTING LAB
dialogues.text: A large, ultra-sophisticated work area, dedicated to the design, fabrication, and testing of SUPERHERO SUITS. E crosses to a large, raised PLATFORM mounted to a track running parallel to a glassed-in chamber, and sits in one of the two chairs facing it. Between the chairs is a small table with a fresh pot of coffee and assorted cookies. E motions Helen to join her-~

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: Come, sit. Cream and sugar? Helen shakes her head, feeling a little bewildered, and sits as E pours and hands her a cup of coffee. E (CONT’D) I started with the baby...

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: “Started”?

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: Shh, darling, shh--! Inside the chamber, a panel opens. A small, featureless BABY MANNEQUIN in a tiny red SUIT (sporting the same “i” insignia as Bob’s) mounted to a post emerges, tracking slowly from one end of the chamber to the other. E (CONT’D) ..-I cut it a little roomy for the free movement, the fabric is comfortable for sensitive skin-- The inside of the chamber ERUPTS in FLAMES. Helen jumps back as E continues talking-- E (CONT’D) --and can also withstand a temperature of over one thousand degrees~-— The flames are suddenly replaced by a barrage of MACHINE GUN FIRE, as the suit is blasted by hundreds of bullets--

dialogues.speaker: E, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: --completely bulletproof-- The GUNFIRE stops.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: E (cONT‘D) -~and machine-washable, darling, that’s a new feature.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: What in heaven’s name do you think the baby will be doing???

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: Well, I’m sure I don’t know, darling. Luck favors the prepared. I didn’t know the baby’s powers so I covered the basics-

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Jack-Jack doesn’t have any powers.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: No? Well, he’1l look fabulous anyway. As the Baby suit exits one end, the panel REOPENS on the other side. Another MANNEQUIN Dash's size swings into the smoky chamber; its arms and legs slowly churning in a “running” motion which gradually accelerates into a BLUR.

dialogues.speaker: E, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your boy’s suit I designed to withstand enormous friction without heating up or wearing out, a useful feature... The Dash suit departs into the wall as a new suit enters.

dialogues.speaker: E, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your daughter’s suit was tricky, but I finally created a sturdy material that will disappear completely as she does. Helen’s suit moves into view. ROBOT ARMS enter from above and below, CLAMP to the sleeves of arms and pants, and begin to PULL them wide apart in various contortions-- E (CONT’D) Your suit can stretch as far as you can without injuring yourself and still retain its shape. Two small BOMBS appear on either side of the suit and EXPLODE, bending the E (CONT‘D) Virtually indestructible, yet it breathes like Egyptian cotton. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: E, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As an extra feature, each suit contains a Homing Device, giving you the precise global location of the wearer at the touch of a button.
