The chamber goes dark, the lights return to their less— dramatic setting. E swivels to face Helen, a cocky smile playing at the corners of her mouth. E (CONT’D) Well, darling? What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: What do I think?? Bob is retired! I'm retired! Our family is underground! You helped my husband resume secret hero work behind my back??

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: I assumed you knew, darling! Why would he keep secrets from you?

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: (defensive) He wouldn't! He didn’t-- doesn’t! There is a heavy PAUSE. E considers her.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: Men at Robert’s age are often unstable. Prone to weakness.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: What are you saying...?

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: Do you know where he is...?

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: Do you KNOW where he is?

dialogues.speaker: SEA CLIFFS
dialogues.text: Bob hiding in brush at the top of a cliff. Along the waterline far below, a monopod streaks toward him along a track which curves around the coastline. Bob crouches... and DIVES-~ ~-we fall with him, whistling through the air until we hit a PALM TREE. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The palm BENDS, slowing Bob’s drop before he expertly releases it and drops into another palm directly below it. Bob leaps onto the roof of the pod, quickly dispatching the guards inside, tossing them into the ocean. Bob seats himself at the controls, as the pod races toward Syndrome’s base and a security checkpoint.

dialogues.speaker: CHECKPOINT
dialogues.text: Two GUARDS look up as they hear the monopod approach. A sparking WHEEL CARRIAGE arrives at the gate, its cab completely torn off and missing. Suddenly alert, the GUARDS cock their guns and aim into the dark. We hear a distant GRUNT. A moment later the CAB falls from the sky, crashing on top of the GUARDS. Bob runs through the wrecked gate, toward the base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob pulls up behind some trees. There are several GUARDS; two at the vehicle entrance, another at the balcony above. Bob thinks a bit, looks down and finds a COCONUT, With expert precision, he throws it at the balcony guard, BEANING HIM. He falls off the balcony and hits the ground. The other guards rush to help him, leaving their post. Bob runs up to the vehicle entrance-- it’s locked tight. Bob sees shadows of guards approaching, he’s out in the open and about to be caught when-- ~-the door suddenly sweeps up and open, taking Bob with it. An AMBULANCE moves out of the open bay, and as the door moves closed behind it we see Bob drop into the garage. Elevator. Bob emerges in the DINING HALL and stares at the LAVA FALL. He knows there is a secret passage behind it. Picks up large stone sculpture. Readies to run into lava. One... two... thr-- Bob is startled by a flash of light behind the fall; the passage is opening. He loses his balance, struggling to set the massive sculpture back into place before Mirage enters. Bob rushes into the closing passage. Jumps clear just as passage CLOSES. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A series of parallel floor lights click on. Bob follows them to an ELABORATE CHAIR in the center of the dark, lit from above. Bob sits down in the chair. A GIANT, CURVED SCREEN lights up in front of him, with a blinking cursor in its center. Bob types in “KRONOS”. The computer screen refreshes: Bob is IN. RESUME E’S LAB Helen on phone. E listens intently in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Hello, this is Helen Parr, Bob Parr is my husband. I was wondering if you could give me the number of the hotel he’s staying at. The number I have is no good.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: Mr. Parr no longer works at Insuricare.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: What do you mean? He-- he’s on a business trip, a company retreat~-

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: My records say he was terminated almost two months ago. Helen HANGS UP in a daze.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: So. You don't know where he is... Helen shakes her head. E HOLDS UP the HOMING DEVICE.

dialogues.speaker: E, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Would you like to find out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob enters the computer record of the development of the OMNIDROID. It squares off Superheroes on one half of the screen with progressively more advanced versions of the Omnidroid. A “TERMINATED” band blots out the loser of each encounter. Bob's eyes fill with horror: Syndrome has been using Superheroes to beta~test his Omnidroid killing machines, starting with the weaker Superheroes and working his way up as the robots became more deadly.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Pace after face of deceased Superheroes flash by:

dialogues.speaker: GAZERBEAM... GAMMA JACK... EVERSEER..-
dialogues.text: Bob turns away, staggered. He types in the name: ELASTIGIRL. Under “whereabouts” the computer answers “UNKNOWN”. Bob heaves a sigh of relief. INT. E’S LAB - SAME MOMENT Helen reluctantly takes the homing locator from E and stares at it, not sure she wants to know what it may tell her. SYNDROME’S MASTER COMPUTER ROOM ~ WITH BOB Bob is now looking at Syndrome’s master plan, which seems to indicate unleashing the Omnidroid on a major city. A countdown has already started: it’s happening within 24 hours. Bob rises from the console and starts for the

dialogues.speaker: EXIT,
dialogues.text: INT. E’S LAB - SAME MOMENT Helen presses the locator button on the homing tracker. On the viewscreen, the locator isolates a remote island.

dialogues.speaker: WITH BOB
dialogues.text: As the dot over the “i” on his chest-logo LIGHTS UP... beeping. Bob looks down in surprise. An alarm sounds as the room is awash in bright light. Unwittingly Helen has exposed him. Bob races for the exit, but is hit by sticky balls of goo fired from guns lining the walls, which INFLATE, quickly making it impossible to run. Bob falls to the floor, swallowed up by the expanding goo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The expanding goo-balis fill up the P.O.V.... but not before Bob makes out the recognizable figure approaching him: MIRAGE.

dialogues.speaker: E'S KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Coffee has been made and partially consumed. The morning paper, still rolled, rests on the table. Helen, eyes reddened from crying, blows her nose into a wadded length of toilet paper handed her by a mildly disgusted £. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: I’m such an idiot. I let this happen you know. The new sports car, the getting in shape, the blonde hair, the lies!

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: Yes. He attempts to relive the past.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: And now I’m losing him! (sobbing) What‘1ll I do? What‘’ll I do??

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: What are you talking about...? E suddenly leaps onto the table. She WHACKS Helen with the rolled-up newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: E, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: YOU ARE ELASTIGIRL! My God, pull yourself together!! What will you do? Is this a question? You will show him you remember that he is Mr. Incredible, and you will remind him who YOU are. Well, you know where he is. Go. Confront the problem!

dialogues.speaker: FIGHT
dialogues.text: (pleasantly) And call me when you get back, darling. fi enjoy our visits.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE PARR HOUSE
dialogues.text: Readying to leave, Helen talks to Violet as they walk toward Helen's bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: There's lots of leftovers you can reheat. Make sure Dash does his homework and both of you get to bed on time. I should be back tonight, late. You can be in charge that long, can’t you?

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Yeah... but why am I in charge again?

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Nothing. Just a little trouble with Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: You mean Dad’s in trouble? Or... Dad is the trouble? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Helen pauses outside her bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: I mean either he’s in trouble... (darkly) ---or he’s going to be.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE MASTER BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Mom enters, looks at her open travel bag, then the SUITS E made. She SIGHS, decides to pack her SUPERSUIT. Then sees Dash staring at the matching bright red outfits.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: Hey what's THAT? Where'd you get that, Mom? Mom STRETCHES to slam the door closed. IMMEDIATELY Dash is outside the sliding window, looking in. DASH (CONT’D) You made a cool outfit? Hey, are those for us?? We all get cool outfits? Mom stretches to pull the blinds, briefly taking her hand off the doorknob. Dash ZOOMS back through the door, nabs his outfit and is gone. Helen calls after him.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Wait a-- DASH! You come back THIS MOMENT! The phone RINGS. Helen, expecting it, quickly picks up.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey Snug! Thanks for getting back. Listen, I know this is short notice-- Violet has entered. She stares at the suits on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: What are these? Dash ZIPS back in, fully dressed in his suit.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: Look! I'm “The Dash.” (zips to mirror) The Dash likes. Helen tries to zip up her bag and return Violet's suit to the closet. Violet is back though, and SEES this. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: (inte phone) Just a moment-- (irritated, to Dash) Take that off, before somebody sees you.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET HELEN
dialogues.text: But you’re packing one just Please, honey, I’m on the like it. Are you hiding phone-- DASH! something? Mom? Dash whisks the suit from Helen, offers it to Violet.

dialogues.speaker: DASH VIOLET
dialogues.text: This is yours! It’s {to Helen) specially made. What‘s going on--? Helen pushes BOTH children out into the hall and SLAMS her door. Violet looks at the suit, then at Dash.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: What makes you think it’s special?

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: I’unno. Why’d Mom try to hide it? Dash runs off. Violet looks at the suit, wondering. Making her hand invisible, she touches the suit-- --it VANISHES. She draws back, taking her finger off the suit: it REAPPEARS. Violet stares at the suit with wide eyes: WHOA.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: (into phone) Snug, I'm calling in a solid you-owe-me. SNUG’S OFFICE ~ AIRPORT Cluttered and comfortable. A blown-in-the-bottle museum of flying arcana. SNUG PORTER, lean, leathery and laugh- lined, twirls a pencil as he takes the call.

dialogues.speaker: SNUG
dialogues.text: About time. What’s it been? 15 years? I was starting to get comfortable. Whaddya need?

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: A jet. What can you get that’s fast? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Snug turns to his office window, which looks out onto the tarmac, and lifts a few venetian blinds, REVEALING an amazingly sleek and powerful-looking jet.

dialogues.speaker: SNUG
dialogues.text: Let me think...

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE THE CLOUDS
dialogues.text: The JET soars through the golden late-afternoon sky. INSIDE THE JET’S COCKPIT - SAME TIME Helen pilots the jet as she speaks into her headset.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Island approach, India Golf Niner niner checking in, VFR on top-- over. No response. Helen checks the instruments, confirms her course. She tries again.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Island Tower. This is India Golf Niner niner requesting vectors vectors to the initial... over. (static) Huh. An old sensation begins to creep into Helen’s thoughts: danger. She grabs her duffle bag and zips it open, exposing the SUPERSUIT E made for her. She stares at it. HELEN (CONT’D) Easy, Helen. You're overreacting. Everything’s fine. They’re just-- (tries an explanation) ~-all getting coffee at the same time... Helen mulls the explanation. And decides it's ridiculous. She flips a switch-- putting the jet on AUTOPILOT, grabs her suit and goes into the lavatory.

dialogues.speaker: NOMANISAN
dialogues.text: Bob awakens... and finds himself bound by huge metal restraints, facing a nasty looking DEVICE that looks something like an electrified bed of nails. Syndrome approaches Bob.

dialogues.speaker: SYNDROME
dialogues.text: You, Sir, truly are “Mr. Incredible”... You know, I was right to idolize you. (MORE } (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SYNDROME, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I always knew you were tough. But tricking the probe by hiding under the bones of another Super? Ohhhh, MAN!! I’m still geeking out about it... (his expression SOURS) Then you had to go and just-~ ruin the ride. I mean, Mr. Incredible calling for help? “Help me!” Lame lame lame lame LAME! Alright, who did you contact? Bob stares at Syndrome.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: contact? What are you talking about? Syndrome nods at a flunky, who presses a button. The TORTURE DEVICE jumps to life, emitting sparks as Bob winces in pain.

dialogues.speaker: SYNDROME
dialogues.text: I’m referring to last night at 23:07 hours, while you were snooping around, you sent out a homing signal--

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (in pain) I didn’t know... about the homing device-- Syndrome ZAPS Bob again. He spasms, grimacing.

dialogues.speaker: SYNDROME
dialogues.text: --and now a government plane is requesting permission to land here! WHO

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: ...I didn’t send for... a plane--

dialogues.speaker: SYNDROME
dialogues.text: (to Mirage) Play the transmission.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Island approach, India Golf Niner niner checking in, VFR on top-- Bob’s head snaps to attention. Syndrome sees it.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Helen...!

dialogues.speaker: SYNDROME
dialogues.text: So you do know these people. Well, then, I‘ll send them a little greeting... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: With flourish and a malicious grin, Syndrome presses the red LAUNCH button on a control console.

dialogues.speaker: MAIN CABIN
dialogues.text: Helen emerges from the lavatory dressed in her SUPERSUIT. She throws her duffle bag ROUGHLY at a passenger seat. VIOLET’S VOICE Ow!

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Violet!

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: {as she MATERIALIZES) It’s not my fault! Dash ran away and I knew I’d get blamed for it and~- Dash pops up from behind the seats at the back of the cabin, immediately engaging at the top of his lungs.

dialogues.speaker: DASH VIOLET
dialogues.text: THAT’S NOT TRUE! YOU said, --I thought he'd try to “Something's up with Mom” sneak on the plane so I and “We hafta find out came here and you closed what,” and it was YOUR the doors before I could IDEA, YOUR IDEA, 100% ALL- find him and then you took YOURS~ALL-THE-TIME IDEA! off and it’s NOT MY FAULT!

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. You left Jack-Jack ALONE??

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET DASH
dialogues.text: Yes, Mom! I'm completely No, we got someone, Mom! stupid. Of course we got a Someone great! We wouldn’= sitter! Do you think I'm do that! I love my baby totally irresponsible? brother! Thanks a lot! HELEN (CONT’D) Well, who’d you get???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sporting a ponytail, baggy baseball shirt and a mouthtu: of orthodontia, KARI MCKEON--thirteen, stands in the middle of the Parr living room, chatting into the phone. as Jack-Jack plays happily in the background.  78.

dialogues.speaker: KARI
dialogues.text: You don't have to worry about one single thing, Mrs. Parr, I’ve got this babysitting thing wired. I’ve taken courses and learned CPR, and I got excellent marks and certificates I can produce on demand. INTERCUT: Helen on the jet.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Kari...

dialogues.speaker: KARI
dialogues.text: I also brought Mozart to play while he sleeps because leading experts say “Mozart makes babies smarter’-~

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Kari...

dialogues.speaker: KARI
dialogues.text: ~-and the beauty part is, the babies don’t even have to listen ‘cause they’re asleep! I wish my parents played Mozart when I slept, because half the time I don't know what the heck anyone's talking about!

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Kari, I really don’t feel comfortable with this. I’1l pay you for your trouble but I’d really rather call a service--

dialogues.speaker: KARI
dialogues.text: There’s really no need, Mrs. Parr. I can handle anything this baby can dish out. (cooing to Jack-Jack) can’t I, little boobily boy?

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Kari, I appreciate your qualifications and your... your enthusiasm, but-- A warning signal SOUNDS from the cockpit. Helen turns, recognizing it instantly.

dialogues.speaker: COCKPIT
dialogues.text: Helen ENTERS. Through the windshield, a rocket’s flare is suddenly visible above the clouds. Helen's eyes WIDEN.  79.

dialogues.speaker: MAIN CABIN
dialogues.text: The “fasten seat belts” sign above Dash and Vi LIGHTS UP. They exchange glances, reach for their seat belts. The jet suddenly DIVES, throwing them into the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: ~~Friendlies at two zero miles south southwest of your position, angels 10. Track east, disengage, over!! Disengage!!

dialogues.speaker: ROARING THROUGH THE CLOUDS
dialogues.text: as the jet BANKS suddenly, barely avoiding a missile that smokes past its metallic belly. RESUME SYNDROME’S BASE ~ PRISON CELL ~- SAME MOMENT

dialogues.speaker: HELEN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: India Golf Niner niner transmitting in the blind guard--

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: No--! RESUME HELEN’S JET - SAME MOMENT Through the windshield we see the clouds suddenly part, revealing: THE OCEAN looming toward us like an endless brick wall. Helen plants her feet and YANKS BACK on the controls--

dialogues.speaker: THE WATER'S SURFACE
dialogues.text: The jet’s belly spanks the crests of the waves as it struggles to pull out of its dive.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME COCKPIT
dialogues.text: as the jet is buffeted by the peaks of the ocean waves, its engines screaming as it finally reascends. The jet goes vertical, throwing the kids backwards down the aisle. Helen stabilizes the jet, then DOUBLE-TAKES as the missiles reappear on her screen. She whirls to Violet--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Vi! I need you to throw a force field around the plane!

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: But you said never to-- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: I know what I said!! Listen to what I‘m saying now!!

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: --I’ve never done one that big before! RESUME SYNDROME’S BASE - PRISON CELL - SAME MOMENT VIOLET (CONT’D, OVER

dialogues.speaker: RADIO
dialogues.text: It’s not like I’ve been practicing!!

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: NO! Call off the missiles!! I’1l do anything!!

dialogues.speaker: SYNDROME
dialogues.text: Too late. Fifteen years too late.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME JET
dialogues.text: Violet FRETS, not sure where to start. She uncertainly starts to form a force field, but it’s small and weak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELEN whirls toward the cockpit-- The jet’s RADAR display shows the missiles CONVERGING-~ The MISSILES CLOSE IN on the jet-- HELEN shouts into her headset, EYES WIDENING in horror as The MISSILES CLOSE in on the jet's belly and-- Helen throws off her headset, leaps out of her seat and-- --STRETCHES: enveloping her kids an instant before-~ --the jet EXPLODES, becoming a roiling fireball as the missile cuts it in half. RESUME SYNDROME’S BASE - PRISON CELL ~ SAME MOMENT BOB REACTS in HORROR as the RADAR indicates a HIT!

dialogues.speaker: RESUME JET EXPLOSION
dialogues.text: An orange-red ball emerges from the blast and slowly unfurls: it’s HELEN (who’s OUT COLD) and the KIDS, who are WIDE AWAKE and screaming as they free-fall toward the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gl.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Helen COMES TO and SEES her children plummeting to their deaths. She STRETCHES her arms, pulling the kids in as she FORMS into a PARACHUTE to arrest their descent.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Brace yourselves!

dialogues.speaker: THE OCEAN
dialogues.text: SPLASHDOWN. The Kids break the water’s surface in shock, sputtering and splashing.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Mom! What're we gonna do? What're we gonna do??? (etc.)

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: I’1ll tell you what we’re not going to do. We‘re not going to panic, and we're not goi-- LOOK OUT!! Helen shoves the kids clear, diving--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as a chunk of FUSELAGE hits with a thunderous SPLASH. Helen watches it quickly disappear into the depths-- RESUME BOB’S CELL

dialogues.speaker: RADIO
dialogues.text: We have a confirmed hit. Target was destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: SYNDROME
dialogues.text: Ah, you'll get over it. I seem to recall you prefer to... “work alone.” With sudden RAGE Bob bursts free of his leg cuffs, driving his legs forward with tremendous force, and LUNGES for Syndrome. Mirage sees him and shoves Syndrome clear, gets snagged in Bob’s arms. Bob is yanked back into the grid, his arm cuffs pulled in opposite directions, Mirage now caught in the middle.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Release me. Now!!

dialogues.speaker: SYNDROME
dialogues.text: Or what? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: I’1l crush her.

dialogues.speaker: SYNDROME
dialogues.text: Sounds a little dark for you. Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: MIRAGE
dialogues.text: No-~

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: It’ll be easy. Like breaking a toothpick.

dialogues.speaker: SYNDROME
dialogues.text: Show me. A contest of wills as the two stare each other down. But Bob doesn’t have it in him. He lets her go. Mirage drops to the floor. Syndrome looks at Bob and sneers. SYNDROME (CONT‘D) I knew you couldn’t do it. Even when you have nothing to lose. You’re weak. I've outgrown you. Syndrome EXITS, followed by the technician and, finally, Mirage. The room is empty and silent, save for the soft sound of the suspension arcs holding Bob. Softly, Mr. Incredible begins to WEEP.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME OCEAN
dialogues.text: Dash and Violet tread water, anxiously look at Mom.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET DASH
dialogues.text: Omigod... omigod... ! The We're dead! We're dead! We plane! It blew up! survived but we‘re dead!

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: STOP ITLil! Helen SPLASHES their faces, startling them SILENT. HELEN (CONT’D) We are NOT going to die! Now both of you will GET A GRIP or so help me I’11 ground you for a month! Understand??? The kids NOD. Helen looks up at the missile trails.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Those were short-range missiles. Land~ based. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: HELEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (pointing to missiles’ origin) That way is our best bet.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: You want to go toward the people that tried to kill us??

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: If it means land... yes.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: You expect us to swim there?

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: I expect you... to trust me.

dialogues.speaker: MOVING OVER THE OCEAN
dialogues.text: A BOAT gains into the frame, skimming over the water at a great speed. Violet appears to be the only passenger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see that the boat is actually HELEN, who has contorted herself into a reasonable facsimile of an inflatable raft, and Dash-- facing backwards, his legs pounding the water furiously-- is the outboard motor. Violet sits impassively, her long hair streaming in the wind, and tries to find something interesting to look at. The Incredi-boat speeds away from us, heading toward the missile trails’ origins, and the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: NOMANISAN BEACH
dialogues.text: It is just after sunset when Helen, Dash and Violet stagger onto the beach, hungry and exhausted. Helen collapses in an ungainly, slightly stretched out heap, spent... Her body slowly reverting into her usual shape. She looks at Dash with a tired smile.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: What a trooper. I'm so proud of you. Panting, Dash smiles and gives her a weak wave.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: Thanks, Mom.  84.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE A CAVE
dialogues.text: Helen and the kids huddle around a fire, silent and somber. Helen finally breaks the silence.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: I think your father is in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: If you haven’t noticed, Mom, we’re not doing so hot either.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: I’m going to look for him. That means you're in charge until I get back, Violet.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: What???

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: {to Dash) You heard her. Helen reaches into the battered duffle and removes three MASKS. She puts one on, hands the other two to her kids.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Put these on. Your identity is your most valuable possession. Protect it. If anything goes wrong, use your powers.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: But you said we should never--

dialogues.speaker: I KNOW WHAT I SAID
dialogues.text: Helen regrets her outburst at once. She takes a deep breath, composes herself, looks at her kids. HELEN (CONT’D) Remember the bad guys on those shows you used to watch on Saturday morning? (the kids NOD eagerly) Well, these guys are not like those guys. (the kids deflate) They won't exercise restraint because you’re children. They will kill you if they get the chance. Do NOT give them that chance. Vi, I’m counting on you...

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Mom, I--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: {cuts her off, firm) I'm counting on you. Be strong. (beat, turns to Dash) Dash, if anything goes wrong, I want you to run as fast as you can...

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: {excited by this) As fast as I can??

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: As fast as you can. Stay hidden. Keep each other safe. I’1l be back by morning. Helen gives them a long hug, then turns to exit the cave. Violet, looking tortured, runs after her, stops her at the entrance. Tears well up in Violet's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: (excruciating for her) Mom... what happened on the plane, when you asked me t~- I, I wanted to-- I’m sorry... Helen places a finger over Vi's lips. Meets her gaze and speaks in a warm, sure tone.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Shh. It isn’t your fault. It wasn’t fair for me to suddenly ask so much of you. But things are different now. And doubt is a luxury we can’t afford anymore, sweetie. You have more power than you realize. Don’t think. And don’t worry. If the time comes, you'll know what to do. It’s in your blood. Helen gives Violet a firm nod... and disappears into the night. Violet watches her mother get swallowed by the darkness. She looks down at the mask in her hands... ---and carefully puts it on. LAUNCH OBSERVATION CENTER - SYNDROME’S BASE - NIGHT Lost in thought, Syndrome stares down at the massive rocket in the center of the volcano, poised to launch.

dialogues.speaker: MIRAGE
dialogues.text: He's not weak, you know. Mirage is seated at one of the many consoles, taking notes, her back to him. Syndrome snaps out of his dream and turns to Mirage, the only other person in the room.

dialogues.speaker: SYNDROME
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MIRAGE
dialogues.text: Valuing life is not weakness. Syndrome crosses to her, casually dismissive.

dialogues.speaker: SYNDROME
dialogues.text: Hey, if you're talking about what happened in the containment unit, I had everything under control--

dialogues.speaker: MIRAGE
dialogues.text: And disregarding it... is not strength. Syndrome sidies up behind her, lifts her chin with a gentle hand and draws her face toward his.

dialogues.speaker: SYNDROME
dialogues.text: I called his bluff, sweetheart, that’s all. I knew he wouldn’t have it in him to actually-- Mirage shoves his hand aside, and rises to confront him.

dialogues.speaker: MIRAGE
dialogues.text: Next time you gamble, bet your own life. She EXITS, leaving Syndrome befuddled and alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen enters a clearing and looks up. A monorail track soars high above the jungle floor. A monopod is coming. Helen throws her hands high, stretching them up to the pod passing overhead. It yanks her offscreen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen hangs suspended beneath the pod on long arms, alternating hands to swing around the support columns. Gaining momentum with each swing, she throws her body above the roof of the car, landing expertly on top.  87.

dialogues.speaker: ON TOP OF THE POD
dialogues.text: Helen squints into the rushing wind, sees the track slicing through the dense jungle canopy and leading directly into the base of the towering volcano. A familiar HUM causes her to hide, and she slips down one side of the pod, out of view, as TWO HOVERJETS buzz by. Helen watches the jets descend to a landing strip inside the Volcano just as the pod plunges into a tunnel and--

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TUNNEL
dialogues.text: Darkness. Suddenly an opening in the tunnel rushes by, and Helen catches a glimpse of the ROCKET... and WHOOSH-- the pod is back into a tunnel. Helen stretches her torso out like a sail. It catches wind and she releases from the pod, reforms and drops to the tracks with catlike grace.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE BASE
dialogues.text: Helen peeks out of the tunnel, looks out at the heavily guarded launch pad.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: A rocket? Visible inside the open tip of the rocket sits a huge metallic wing with an enormous circular hole EMPTY in its center, waiting to be filled with... what?

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Two armed GUARDS march past CAMERA. Unseen above them, Helen is stretched thin and hiding between a cluster of pipes which run down the center of the corridor. She watches as the guards exit through a sliding door. She drops like a liquid cat to the floor, and begins to move down the corridor. As Helen passes a metal door, she catches sight of her reflection in its shiny surface, She stops, FROWNS. It’s been a while since her last Supersuit; her butt is a bit bigger than she remembered. She wonders if she should lose a few-- --when the WHOOSH of a door surprises her...  88.

dialogues.speaker: A GUARD
dialogues.text: comes through the door at the far end of the hall. As he enters another junction, we see that Helen has contorted herself, arching perfectly around the door frame. The GUARD doesn’t see her. He slides a CARD KEY through a reader to enter a restricted corridor. The doors WHOOSH open. Directly behind him, Helen silently REFORMS and begins to back through the doorway when the doors behind her SLIDE SHUT-~ --trapping HELEN'S LEG. She winces, tries in vain to pull it free. It’s stuck. Leaving one hope-- --the CARD KEY on GUARD #1'S belt. STRETCHING across the corridor, Helen clambers after the guard on the palms of her hands, following him into the--

dialogues.speaker: INNER CHAMBER
dialogues.text: The guard stops at the ELEVATOR and presses the call button, his back to Helen. Just behind him, stretched far and held upright on one hand, Helen reaches with the other for the card key. She almost has it--

dialogues.speaker: AT THE CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: The DOOR suddenly closes on her stretched torso. Her upper third snaps back, her middle third TRAPPED and now stretched across-~

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: TWO MORE GUARDS (#2 & #3) are traveling in a transport. They are suddenly CLOTHESLINED by HELEN’S STRETCHED TORSO.

dialogues.speaker: INNER CHAMBER
dialogues.text: ~-knocking the wind out of HELEN. Directly in front of her at the far end of the hall, the ELEVATOR opens for GUARD #1; revealing GUARD #4 inside. He SEES HELEN.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Hey! Helen’s arm stretches forward--  89.

dialogues.speaker: INNER CHAMBER
dialogues.text: IN A BLINK: her fist CLOCKS GUARD #4, disarms GUARD #1 hitting him with the butt of his gun. AS guard #4 drops to the floor, #1 hits the “CLOSE” button on the panel. The DOORS CLOSE on Helen’s ARM. Guard #1 GRINS. Helen’s HAND FEELS AROUND, finds GUARD #1, his chest... chin... face and-- -~-PUNCHES his lights out. He DROPS.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME MIDDLE CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: The TORSO GUARDS (#2 & #3) get to their feet, and see HELEN, her ARM still stretched, through the glass door. They level their guns at her. At the same moment--

dialogues.speaker: BLUE CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: ANOTHER GUARD (#5) comes upon Helen’s LEG in the closed doors. The sight is so odd, he can only stare. He decides to poke the leg with the barrel of his machine gun.

dialogues.speaker: WITH HELEN
dialogues.text: --as she REACTS to the poke. She SCOWLS--

dialogues.speaker: RESUME BLUE CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: ~-her LEG cocks back and FISHTAIL~KICKS GUARD #5, He flies backwards, his weapon discharging into the card scanner. The DOOR OPENS-- freeing Helen’s LEGS, which sail across the corridor and-- SMASH the TORSO GUARDS (#2 & #3) against the middle door. They slide down into a heap... out cold.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: Helen’s arm finds one of the guards’ CARD KEY, slides it into the door scanner. The doors OPEN, releasing her torso.

dialogues.speaker: ACCESS CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Helen drags the last of the UNCONSCIOUS GUARDS over to an open wall panel and stuffs him inside with the others. She throws her weight against the panel, finally getting it shut.  90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --glowing purple and fluttering around a campfire, it struggles to take form and finally does, trapping the fire's smoke inside.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CAVE
dialogues.text: Dash watches as Violet practices intently. She releases the force field sphere; the dark smoke ball rises upwards. Vi throws another force field, recapturing the smoke at the roof of the cave. Dash gets to his feet, grabs a burning branch from the fire to use as a torch.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: Welp, not that this isn’t fun... but I’m gonna go look around.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: What do you think is going on here? You think we’re on vacation or something? Mom and Dad's lives could be in jeopardy. Or worse... their marriage.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: Their marriage? (Vi NODS sharply, PAUSE) So... the bad guys are trying to wreck Mom’s and Dad’s marriage??

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Forget it. You’re so immature.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: (exiting) Okay, I’m gonna go look around.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Mom said to stay hidden.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna leave the cave. Sheesh!

dialogues.speaker: ROCKET CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: Ground control technicians watch from the observation window as a GIANT METAL SPHERE, a massive version of the dreaded OMNIDROID... is carefully guided into place inside the top stage of the rocket. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The rocket’s NOSE CONE is lowered over the OMNIDROID and secured into place. The cylindrical BLAST SHIELD closes around the rocket.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CAVE
dialogues.text: Lighting his way with a burning branch, Dash explores the depths of the cave. Suddenly the floor becomes smooth. Dash looks down, then holds his torch up. He's inside an enormous man-made TUNNEL.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: Cool... His voice ECHOES a bit. Dash brightens. He calls again, louder this time.

dialogues.speaker: DASH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: CooL! His voice ECHOES: “Cool! Cool! Cool!”

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: Syndrome shoves a PASS KEY into the control board, gives the key a twist... then presses the LAUNCH button.

dialogues.speaker: LAUNCH TUBE
dialogues.text: The rocket’s engines FIRE. The sound is deafening as the rocket’s massive weight slowly lifts into the air...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CAVE
dialogues.text: A low RUMBLE and a subtle push of warm wind emanate from the depths of the tunnel, which begins to GLOW. Dash’s smile drops as he realizes it’s an enormous FIREBALL rocketing towards him. He turns and RUNS.

dialogues.speaker: WITH VIOLET
dialogues.text: vii is still practicing force fields when the depths of the cave begin to rumble and glow. She looks up. DASE’S VOICE Vitli Vi Vi Vi Vi villl

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: {Vi sees cave brightening) What did you DO?!  92.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE CAVE
dialogues.text: Dash and Violet race out of the cave, getting clear just as an enormous wall of FLAMES erupts after them. They look down with a shudder at how close they came. A roar behind them causes them to turn-- a ROCKET emerges from the center of the volcano, and soars into the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: Helen looks down from some vents in the ceiling. Silently she stretches her neck until her head dangles down behind the guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen scans the detention grid... and notices a tremendous spike of power to restrain the prisoner in cell 13.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Bob... Helen quickly pulls her head back up through the vent in the ceiling and EXITS.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Huh? What...?

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: I didn’t say anything.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE THE EARTH
dialogues.text: The final stage of the Omnidroid’s capsule separates. The Omni ship begins to descend below the cloud layer, toward the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dash awakens, discovering to his horror that he’s curled up with Violet. Repulsed, he JUMPS UP and shudders.

dialogues.speaker: O.S. VOICE
dialogues.text: Identification? Startled, Dash turns toward the sound. A brightly colored BIRD perches in a nearby tree.

dialogues.speaker: BIRD
dialogues.text: Identification, please...? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: (laughs, NUDGES Vi) Hey, Violet! Look! It talks!

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: (half asleep) Hmn? What...

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: (pointing) There... that one. Violet walks up and stares, also beguiled by the bird.

dialogues.speaker: BIRD
dialogues.text: Voice key incorrect. Dash chortles. Violet’s smile starts to FADE--

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: “Voice key”...? Wait a second... The bird’s head slowly SWIVELS toward the kids with a soft COMPUTING SOUND. Its eyes LIGHT UP RED as its beak drops open, and it lets out a shrill electronic ALARM.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME JUNGLE
dialogues.text: Violet backs away from the shrieking bird, Dash following after her, panicking.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: What do we do??

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: Where are we going??

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Away from here!? They turn and RUN. The SHRIEKING BIRD takes wing, following after them. INT. SYNDROME’S BASE - MONITORING STATION Alarms sound. A section of the island grid LIGHTS UP, locating the KIDS. A guard hits the SCRAMBLE button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSIDE SYNDROME’S BASE - SAME MOMENT Helen hears the alarm, watches as the guards scramble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guards on VELOCIPODS zoom out into jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob hangs, defeated, in the suspension beams. The cell door slides OPEN. A FIGURE is silhouetted there-- MIRAGE. She switches off the suspension ray. Bob drops to the floor. Bob just sits there on his knees, his eyes cast downward. Mirage crosses to him, kneels down...

dialogues.speaker: MIRAGE
dialogues.text: There isn’t much time-~ Bob’s hand flashes out and CLAMPS around her throat. He RISES, holding her dangling body aloft with one hand.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: No, there isn’t. In fact, there’s no time at all.

dialogues.speaker: MIRAGE
dialogues.text: (gasping) «.-pl--ease...

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Why are you here? How can you possibly bring me lower? What more can you take away from me??

dialogues.speaker: MIRAGE
dialogues.text: (struggling to speak) F-~amily... survived the crash... they’re here-- on the island...

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: -..they’re-- alive?? Bob releases his grip, Mirage drops to the floor, gasping raggedly. Bob lifts her up and EMBRACES her. Mirage drinks it in, then REACTS at the sight of a figure in the doorway. Bob LOOKS UP.

dialogues.speaker: BOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Helen-~? Mirage and Bob push apart, Mirage composing herself.

dialogues.speaker: MIRAGE
dialogues.text: Hello! You must be Mrs. Incr-~ Helen's fist flies across the room and CRACKS across Mirage’s jaw. Mirage spins and crashes to the ground. Bob seizes Helen's stretched wrist--

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: She was helping me to escape-~

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: No, that’s what I was doing! Bob pulls her to him. She resists, pushing him away with her stretchy limbs like a cat being forced into a bath as

dialogues.speaker: HELEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let go of me-- LET GO-- you lousy, lying, unfaithful, creep, I-- ~-Bob smothers her protests with a big kiss.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: How could I betray the perfect woman?

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: (still irked) Oh, you’re referring to me now...

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Where are the kids? Mirage sits up, holding her jaw.

dialogues.speaker: MIRAGE
dialogues.text: They might’ve triggered the alert. Security's been sent into the jungle. You'd better get going.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: What?? Now our kids are in danger?? Bob and Helen turn to exit, bickering as they do.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: If you suspected danger, why‘d you bring them?

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: I didn’t bring them, they stowed away and I don't think you’re striking the proper tone here-~  36.

dialogues.speaker: JUNGLE
dialogues.text: Running blindly. The kids are suddenly confronted by GUARDS on three manned VELOCIPODS. Glancing at the GUARDS, Violet speaks quietly to Dash.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Dash. Remember what Mom said.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: LEAD GUARD
dialogues.text: Stop talking! Abruptly Vi VANISHES. Dash looks around in surprise. VIOLET’S VOICE Dash!! RUN!! Suddenly understanding-- Dash BOLTS, jumping from the transport and vanishing into the jungle. It happens FAST: The GUARD’S head snaps toward the sound of Vi’s VOICE. He swings his rifle-- we hear a heavy THUD as Violet’s (invisible) body is knocked from the transport: a cloud of dust surrounds an impression in the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: They're SUPERS!

dialogues.speaker: GET THE BOY
dialogues.text: 3 GUARDS take off after Dash on VELOCIPODS.

dialogues.speaker: LEAD GUARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Show yourself!

dialogues.speaker: RACING THROUGH THE JUNGLE
dialogues.text: Dash BLASTS through the foliage on foot, unbelievably FAST, a manned VELOCIPOD hot on his tail. But the terrain is dense, uneven and difficult, and Dash is forced to adhere to the thin TRAIL winding through the growth.

dialogues.speaker: UP AHEAD
dialogues.text: a SWARM of flies fusses in the air. Suddenly Dash bursts into view; rocketing RIGHT THROUGH the SWARM! BUGS splatter Dash’s face like an interstate windshield-- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: AGGCCHH
dialogues.text: Dash STUMBLES, careens end over end through the undergrowth like an Indy 500 car crash, and finally tumbles to a stop. Unharmed, but thoroughly REPULSED, Dash wipes his bug-spattered face and teeth.

dialogues.speaker: DASH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Achpppt!! PtTHWAAAGH! PTHPT! A Velocipod bursts out of the brush after him and he TAKES OFF, tearing through the jungle. Running fast, Dash grabs a LONG VINE-- which sends him out in a wide arc that surprises the trailing GUARD. HE SHOOTS PAST Dash and roars off into the undergrowth. Dash releases the vine, tumbling roughly to his feet, and RUNS. A Velocipod bursts out of the brush and is on top of him. Impossibly, Dash ACCELERATES, staying just ahead of it. He sees ANOTHER VINE, grabs it and is PROPELLED UPWARDS-~

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE THE TREES
dialogues.text: Dash explodes out of the canopy, flailing, out of control. He looks down and sees-- ~-the treetops suddenly DROP AWAY. Dash is FALLING OFF A CLIFF, SCREAMING his ten-year-old lungs out as he-- --LANDS ON A VELOCIPOD!! Fleetingly astonished by his good luck, DASH LOOKS UP as the startled GUARD whirls around to face him. The guard SWINGS. Dash DUCKS and reluctantly throws a PUNCH at the guard’s face. It lands! Thrilled that his raw speed renders the guard powerless to dodge or return his punches, Dash LAUGHS and, growing more confident with each punch, socks the GUARD again and again, blissfully unaware that NO ONE IS DRIVING. Dash LOOKS UP. His jaw drops: a ROCK WALL looms ahead! Dash POINTS at it. The GUARD sees an opening and SOCKS Dash in the face, knocking him off just as-~ --the velocipod slams into the cliff face, vaporizing in a FIREBALL! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dash FALLS: making desperate, flailing GRABS as he HITS limb after limb of an enormous tree, finally getting hold of a branch and arresting his descent. He pants, heart racing, and looks down to see-~ --his feet dangling about a yard off the jungle floor. Elated about his survival, Dash drops to the ground and lets out a loud WHOOP, immediately alerting--

dialogues.speaker: TWO GUARDS ON VELOCIPODS
dialogues.text: nearby to his presence. They turn their V-pods after him.

dialogues.speaker: WITH DASH
dialogues.text: as he BOLTS again, accelerating to breakneck speed. He smashes through an endless succession of FOLIAGE-- nearly colliding with tree trunks and rocks and SUDDENLY-- A LAGOON lies in front of him. Dash REACTS: the V~PODS are on his tail, he has nowhere to go, so he takes a deep breath and STEPS ON IT-- --and has enough velocity to RUN ACROSS THE WATER! Amazed and exhilarated, Dash blasts across the water’s surface, weaving like a speedboat around the large volcanic ROCKS jutting out of the water. Velocipods OPEN FIRE... strafing the water as Dash is pursued into a CAVE. VELOCIPOD #2 pulls up short at the cave entrance, and chooses to go around.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CAVE
dialogues.text: Dash runs, Velocipod on his heels. Weaves around rocks, manages to put some distance between himself and Velocipod when he sees-- V-POD #2 coming straight at him! Dash wheels around, his legs churning the water like an cggbeater. He SEES V~POD #1 closing fast. HE HAS NOWHERE TO GO and, like a deer in headlights, Dash STOPS-- ~-suddenly dropping beneath the water’s surface as the Velocipods COLLIDE-- BOOOM!

dialogues.speaker: SOMEWHERE IN THE JUNGLE
dialogues.text: Bob and Helen run, not tired but breathing hard-~ (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: I should've told you I was fired, I admit it, but I didn’t want you to worry--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: You didn’t want me to worry?? And now we're running for our lives through some godforsaken jungle!

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: You keep trying to pick a fight, but I’m still just happy you’re alive--

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER PART OF THE JUNGLE
dialogues.text: The remaining GUARD waits, his machine gun at the ready. Suddenly the dirt MOVES. The guard FIRES, strafing the ground just behind a SUCCESSION OF FOOTPRINTS that streak toward the river moments before a SPLASH appears. THE RIVER - UNDER THE WATER’S SURFACE We see a Violet-shaped DISTORTION as BULLET TRAILS furiously slice the surrounding water.

dialogues.speaker: WITH THE GUARD
dialogues.text: ~-still firing. He STOPS, unnerved and adrenalized. Tensed and ready, he nervously scans the river.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: I know you're there, little Miss Disappear. You can’t hide from me... Training his gun where he last saw Violet, the GUARD grabs a handful of dirt from the riverbank and throws it into the water. He shoulders his RIFLE, watching the dirt turn into a brown CLOUD as it travels downstream... .. making visible a VIOLET-~SHAPED POCKET.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: ...there you are... The guard TAKES AIM and--

dialogues.speaker: HEY
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: --KNOCKING the guard’s gun barrel skyward as it FIRES. The guard swings around-- strafing the ground at DASH’S heels as he plunges back into the jungle. A SPLASH explodes from the river as INVISIBLE VIOLET makes a break for it. THE GUARD sees this and swings the gun toward her as-- DASH blasts out of the jungle and knocks the Guard’s legs out from under him. They TUMBLE and scrap, Dash redeeming his lack of size with lightning-fast punches and feints.

dialogues.speaker: DASH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stay away from my sister!! Disoriented, the guard swings and-- ~=~CONNECTS--— knocking Dash off his feet. He tumbles backward, dazed. The guard shoulders his rifle, leveling it at Dash. Dash looks up; sees he’s screwed. The guard GRINS wickedly... and pulls the trigger-- Violet suddenly APPEARS in mid-air, diving in front of Dash as she THROWS A FORCE FIELD around them! A hail of bullets ricochet off the force field.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE FORCE FIELD
dialogues.text: Dash looks up, sees Violet SUSPENDED IN MID-AIR in the center of the ELECTRIC SPHERE.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: How are you doing that???

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: I don't know!

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: Well, whatever you do-- DON’T STOP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Dash starts to walk within the force field like a gerbil on a wheel. Violet spins ever faster in the sphere’s hub as Dash accelerates into a run. The GUARDS empty their clips at the ROLLING SPHERE with no effect. It rumbles past them and straight into the jungle.  101.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROLLING FORCE FIELD
dialogues.text: as it carries Dash and Vi down a steep hillside into the path of two speeding VELOCIPODS, who FIRE at the sphere. It’s clipped by one Velocipod-- which then spirals into a rock and EXPLODES.

dialogues.speaker: A JUNGLE CLEARING, NOT FAR AWAY
dialogues.text: Bob and Helen hear the EXPLOSION'S echo, and STOP, worried. That’s when they hear the RUMBLE. Before they can get clear, the ROLLING FORCE FIELD bursts out of the brush--

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE SPHERE
dialogues.text: The children REACT as their surprised PARENTS flatten against the force field like dough against a rolling pin, revolving in and out of view.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Mom!! DAD]!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet VANISHES the force field and the entire family tumbles to the jungle floor.

dialogues.speaker: KIDS
dialogues.text: There is a frantic, joyful exchange of hugs and kisses, unfortunately cut short when-- VELOCIPODS explode out of the foliage! The INCREDIBLES instantly jump to their feet: Helen throws a STRETCHED SCISSORS KICK which catches a guard in the chest, knocking him out of his V~pod. Bob CHOPS a second passing velocipod-- it PLOWS straight into the soft jungle floor. Before its PILOT can react-- --Helen’s arm is coiled around him. She YANKS him from the vehicle, whiplashing him into another guard, knocking them both out cold. Bob grabs the crashed V-pod and Frisbees it into a V-pod emerging from the trees--

dialogues.speaker: BOOOOM
dialogues.text: And it's OVER. Bob and Helen had forgotten how good they were. They exchange lustful glances. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BOB & HELEN (CONT’D) (to each other) I love you... Suddenly the jungle is filled with GUARDS and VELOCIPCDS. And just as quickly the INCREDIBLES turn as one against them, a hurricane blur of SUPERPOWERS, suddenly brought to a CRASHING HALT-~ --AS IMMOBI-RAYS strike the Incredibles, SUSPENDING them all, motionless, in MID-AIR.

dialogues.speaker: SYNDROME
dialogues.text: Whoa whoa WHOA-- TIME OUT!! Syndrome keeps his wrists crossed; one BEAM trained on the SUSPENDED COUPLE, the other on the SUSPENDED KIDS.

dialogues.speaker: SYNDROME, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What have we here? Matching uniforms?? He glances between the four faces. His eyes narrow as he zeroes in on Helen. An astonished smile splits his face. SYNDROME (CONT’D) Oh....e. NO-~ Elastigirl?? (laughing, turns to Bob) You... married Elastigirl? (he stops, sees the kids) And got BIZ-ZAY! It’s a whole FAMILY of Supers! Looks like I’ve hit the jackpot! Oh, this is just TOO GoOoD!!

dialogues.speaker: ON A GIANT SCREEN
dialogues.text: of a crowd gathered around a smoldering hulk resting at the base of a large building. The TV channel CHANGES. Another reporter is covering the same story. Camera WIDENS: SYNDROME is delightedly channel surfing with a remote control of his own invention. We are in the-- PRISON CHAMBER - SYNDROME’S BASE — DAY The Incredibles-- Bob, Helen, Violet and Dash-- are all imprisoned side by side in SUSPENSION BEAMS.

dialogues.speaker: SYNDROME
dialogues.text: (turns to Incredibles) Huh? HUH?? Oh, come on, you’ve gotta admit this is cool! Just like a movie! (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SYNDROME, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The robot will emerge dramatically, do some damage, throngs of screaming people, and just when all hope is lost, Syndrome will save the day. I'll be a bigger hero than you ever were!

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: You mean you killed off real heroes so that you could pretend to be one?

dialogues.speaker: SYNDROME
dialogues.text: Oh I’M REAL! Real enough to defeat YOU! And I did it without your precious gifts, your oh-so-special powers! I’1l give them heroics, I'll give ‘em the most spectacular heroics anyone’s ever seen! And when I’m old and I’ve had my fun, I‘1l sell my inventions, so everyone can be Superheroes, everyone can be Super! And when everyone’s Super-- (he turns) ~-no one will be. Syndrome EXITS, cackling.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME CONTAINMENT UNIT
dialogues.text: The Incredibles hang in mid-air, defeated... as a live NEWSCAST covers the terrifying Omnidroid attack.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. The others look up in dull surprise at Bob’s confession.

dialogues.speaker: BOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is my fault. I've been a lousy father. Blind... to what I have. Behind Bob, Violet begins to rock back and forth, revealing that she’s suspended not in Syndrome’s Ray, but in the center of her own force field! BOB (CONT’D) So obsessed with being undervalued that I undervalued ail of you.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: Dad-—

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Sh! Don’t interrupt. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: So caught up in the past that I, I-~ (Bob hesitates, sincere) --you are my greatest adventure. And I almost missed it. Violet has gathered enough momentum to ROLL her sphere out of the suspension beam and over to the control panel. BOB (CONT’D) I swear I’m gonna get us out of this if--

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Well. I think Dad has made some excellent progress today. But it’s time to wind down now-~ Violet throws a switch, releasing the Incredibles from the BEAM. They DROP to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: LAUNCHING BAY
dialogues.text: The Incredibles race through an empty corridor.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: We need to get back to the mainland.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: I saw an aircraft hangar on my way in. Straight ahead, I think-- Bob’s hands pry open the heavy metal doors, crunching them like foil. The INCREDIBLES enter the huge HANGAR unmolested.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Where are all the guards? (to family) Go... gol Laughter drifts out of a large Winnebago crowned with transmission arrays parked near the launchpad.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE WINNEBAGO
dialogues.text: The GUARDS watch live coverage of the OMNIDROID attack on a video monitor. Champagne is popped: the cork is unexpectedly CAUGHT by someone standing in the doorway-- ~-MR. INCREDIBLE. The guards fall SILENT...  105.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE MOBILE UNIT
dialogues.text: The vehicle ROCKS as Bob quickly punches out the guards within. In moments Bob emerges, whistles to his family that the coast is clear.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: This is the hangar, but I don’t see any jets.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: A jet’s not fast enough.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: What's faster than a jet?

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: How about a rocket? The other Incredibles follow Dash’s finger to an enormous shield-shaped ROCKET, identical to the one launched earlier-- save for a perfect circular hole in the center.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Great. I can’t fly a rocket.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: You don't have to. Use the coordinates from the last launch. Bob & Helen BEAM at their daughter’s cleverness. Then Bob's smile FADES.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Wait. I‘1ll bet Syndrome’s changed the password by now. How do I get into the computer? A VOICE comes over the loudspeaker.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Say please. The Incredibles turn and look up. MIRAGE stands in the monitoring station above the launchpad, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stereo plays soft jazz as LUCIUS BEST (aka FROZONE) dresses for dinner. He slaps some aftershave on his face, checking his look in the mirror. A low series of BOOMS grows louder, causing him to look up to see-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ~-the OMNIDROID lumbering past the soaring windows of his fifth floor apartment, a MILITARY CHOPPER strafing it with machine-gun fire. Immediately goes through his dresser drawers. FROZONE HONEY’S VOICE Honey? What? FROZONE HONEY’S VOICE Where's my supersuit? What? FROZONE HONEY’S VOICE WHERE. IS. MY. SUPER. I put it away!

dialogues.speaker: SUIT
dialogues.text: The MILITARY CHOPPER, now on fire, spirals past the picture window and EXPLODES, lighting up the room. FROZONE HONEY’S VOICE WHERE?! Why do you need to know?

dialogues.speaker: FROZONE
dialogues.text: I NEED it! Frozone is running now, down the hallway, going in and out of view, frantically searching rooms and closets.

dialogues.speaker: HONEY'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Huh-uh! You better not be thinking about doing no derring-do! We've been planning this dinner for two months!

dialogues.speaker: FROZONE
dialogues.text: The public is in danger!

dialogues.speaker: HONEY'S VOICE
dialogues.text: My evening’s in danger!

dialogues.speaker: FROZONE
dialogues.text: Tell me where my suit is, woman! We’re talking about the greater good! HONEY’S VOICE "Greater good”?! I am your wife! I am the greatest good you are ever going to get!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver of a gasoline TANKER TRUCK screeches to a halt, his eyes bugging out at the rampaging ROBOT.

dialogues.speaker: RUNI
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He jumps from the truck just as the robot seizes the tanker in a giant claw, and flings it down the street. A YOUNG MOTHER sees it arcing toward her baby carriage.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MOTHER
dialogues.text: My baby! The CROWD is immediately electrified by the sight of the red-haired Superhero. “The Supers have returned!” “Is that Fi-Ronic?” “No, Fi-Ronic has a different outfit!”

dialogues.speaker: SYNDROME
dialogues.text: No, no... I’m a new Superhero! I'm

dialogues.speaker: SYNDROME
dialogues.text: Syndrome carelessly flings the tanker truck behind him with a flourish. It EXPLODES, frightening the crowd. SYNDROME (CONT’D) Alright, stand back! The Omnidroid reaches a massive claw toward Syndrome, who presses a series of buttons on his power cuff. The robot FREEZES suddenly, IDLING. Syndrome smiles, pressing another series of buttons on his remote. SYNDROME (CONT’D) Someone needs to teach this hunk of metal a few manners!! Putting on a good show, Syndrome FLIES around the idling bot, and delivers a punch to one of its leg sockets. OMNIDROID’S P.O.V.: TECHNICAL READOUTS spray across its viewscreen as it confirms Syndromes instructions: RESTRAIN BATTLE MODE. DETACH ARM AT SIGNAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On cue, one of the OMNIDROID’S limbs suddenly FALLS out of its socket, thudding uselessly to the ground. As Syndrome revels in the CHEERS of the crowd, we PUSH IN on the OMNIDROID. It's watching SYNDROME. And THINKING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TECHNICAL READOUTS spray across its viewscreen as it analyzes:

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL STOLEN BY EXTERNAL SIGNAL
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LOCATE SOURCE
dialogues.text: Columns of NUMBERS are crunched. The OMNIDROID’S lens-eye ZOOMS IN on the CONTROL BANDS around Syndrome’s wrist--

dialogues.speaker: SIGNAL SOURCE
dialogues.text: ~-and comes to a logical conclusion:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The OMNIDROID FIRES a precise laser shot, blasting the REMOTE right off Syndrome’s wrist. It clatters to the street. Syndrome whirls around in horror as the BOT goes after him.

dialogues.speaker: OMNIDROID TROUNCES SYNDROME
dialogues.text: knocking him out cold. Robot then resumes its havoc.

dialogues.speaker: FROZONE
dialogues.text: appears on the scene.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH ABOVE THE EARTH
dialogues.text: another ROCKET, identical to the first one, descends from the clouds. Again, it SEPARATES into quarters which fall away, revealing the landing craft inside-- --and only then do we notice what’s different about it: in the center of the large, perfectly round hole designed to house the OMNIDROID is-~ --A WINNEBAGO... precariously held in place by a very stretched, very stressed HELEN.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE VAN
dialogues.text: Bob is at the wheel, Vi and Dash are seated at a small table in the back.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: Are we there yet?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: We get there when we get there! Bob opens his window. Wind RUSHES in, scattering loose debris everywhere.  109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob leans out the window, shouts to Helen up on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: DO I HAVE TO ANSWER
dialogues.text: The GIANT WING is descending, gliding closer to the water, as the CITY looms closer directly ahead.

dialogues.speaker: KIDS
dialogues.text: YOu! The kids move to the seats at the monitor panels, belting themselves in. Bob opens his window, yells up to Helen-- BOB (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: HERE WE GO, HONEY
dialogues.text: (back inside) Ready, Violet? Violet holds a hand over a giant, jerry-rigged release switch.

dialogues.speaker: READY... NOW
dialogues.text: Vi slams the switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The explosive bolts FIRE, separating the wing. Helen LETS GO with a pained shout, swings inside through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob steps on the gas. The van wheels SPIN. Bob tenses as he watches the speedometer move past 110... 120... 130...

dialogues.speaker: THEM
dialogues.text: The VAN SAILS over an overpass, clipping a light pole, and crashes to the pavement in a shower of sparks. FLIES down the street at 200 MPH. Fighting to keep control, Bob

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: hits the BRAKES. SMOKE erupts from the wheel wells.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: The robots in the financial district. Which exit do I take?

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Traction Avenue.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: That’11 take me downtown! I take Seventh, don’t I? Bob cranks the wheel and cuts across several lanes toward the Seventh Street exit.

dialogues.speaker: DON'T TAKE SEVENTH
dialogues.text: Bob aborts the exit, swerving hard to avoid collision.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (furious) Great! We missed it!!

dialogues.speaker: HELEN BOB
dialogues.text: You asked me how to get That'll take me downtown! there and I told you: exit at Traction!

dialogues.speaker: HELEN BOB
dialogues.text: It's coming up! Get in the (changing lanes) right lane! SIGNAL! We don't exit at Traction!

dialogues.speaker: THE VAN
dialogues.text: The VAN takes a violent SWERVE across six lanes, barely making the offramp! Sparks spray as the van slams into the metal railing. The VAN careens off the railing and into traffic, narrowly missing a SEMI. HORNS BLARE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob’s teeth clench as he fights to slow the car down. He STOMPS BOTH FEET on the BRAKES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its tires smoking, the Van pulls sideways and loses it, TUMBLING down the center of the street, spraying metal pieces in its wake. It rolls into an open parking space, and lands-- miraculously upright, stripped like an ear of eaten corn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob and Helen sit up woozily. Bob turns to the kids.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Is everybody okay back there...? Violet and Dash pull themselves upright. They look as if they've emerged from an industrial tumble dryer.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Super~duper, Dad...!

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: Let's do that again! The OMNIDROID comes into view through the cracked windshield. Bob releases his seat belt, turns to Helen.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Wait here and stay hidden. I’m going in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob grimly starts after the Omnidroid. Helen stretches an arm out and grabs his shoulder, spinning him around.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: While what? I watch helplessly from the sidelines? I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: I’m asking you to wait with the kids.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: And I'm telling you “not a chance.” You’re my husband. I’m with you. For better or worse.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: I have to do this alone.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN BOB
dialogues.text: What is this to you? No. Playtime?

dialogues.speaker: HELEN BOB
dialogues.text: So you can be Mr. Not! Incredible again??

dialogues.speaker: HELEN BOB
dialogues.text: Then WHAT? What is it??? I’m... I’m not--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN BOB
dialogues.text: Not what ?? --not strong enough!

dialogues.speaker: HELEN BOB
dialogues.text: “Strong enough"?? And this Yes-- NO!! will make you stronger??

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: That‘s what this is? Some sort of workout? !!

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (grabbing her suddenly)

dialogues.speaker: I CAN'T LOSE YOU AGAIN
dialogues.text: Helen is stunned. She stares at Bob, whose head is bowed like a child. BOB (CONT’D) I can’t. Not again... (a whisper) .-.Z'm not streng enough. Helen searches Bob’s eyes, deeply touched. She throws her arms around him, kissing him.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: If we work together you won‘t have to be. Bok looks into her eyes, equally tender.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: I don’t know what'll happen.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Hey, we’re Superheroes. What could happen? Violet SCREAMS. She and Dash jump clear just as the van is CRUSHED by the Omnidroid’s metal foot. The INCREDIBLES run. Another Omnidroid foot SMASHES into the street, blocking the kids way. Bob and Helen stop, whirling-- HELEN (CONT’D) vi, Dash-- NO!!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The OMNIDROID is now fully focused on the kids, pounding Violet's force field relentlessly with its giant claws. The shield HOLDS. The BOT draws itself up, and DROPS-- the entirety of its massive bulk SLAMS into the force field-- ~-knocking Vi UNCONSCIOUS. Her force field FLICKERS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: Violet...? Again the BOT draws itself up to deliver the crushing blow. Dash cringes and the bot DROPS-- ~-and HITS an obstacle halfway down. Dash looks up-- DASH (CONT’D) Dad! Bob is underneath the bot, on his back, his arms and legs straining under the weight of it.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Go... go--! Vi comes to, and is instantly YANKED out from under the machine and into Helen’s arms. Dash follows them around the corner. Straining, Bob lifts the BOT enough to get his feet underneath him. The bot snatches Bob out from underneath and flings him at a building across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The windows SHATTER as Bob's body tumbles across the floor, scattering desks and chairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen rounds a corner out of the Omnidroid’s view and carefully sets Violet down. She looks at Dash and Vi.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: (firm) Stay here. Okay? Helen turns away, charging back toward the robot. Vi and Dash watch their fearless mother in amazement.  114.

dialogues.speaker: WITH BOB AND THE OMNIDROID
dialogues.text: as the bot pulls itself up the building to look for Bob. Bob charges the bot, hitting it with enough force to dislodge it from the building. It FALLS, crashing into the street with an earth-shattering BOOM. Bob falls with it but rolls and lands on his feet. The familiar sound of cracking ice causes Bob to look up--

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Frozone! YEAH!! A narrow sheet of ice streaks across the pavement and FROZONE skates past, joining the fight.

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOWING FROZONE
dialogues.text: He moves to the Omnidroid, expertly icing its joints as it tries to get up. The machine WHINES as its motors strain against the ice.

dialogues.speaker: FURTHER DOWN THE STREET
dialogues.text: Helen rushes up to Bob.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Bob-~ Just then Frozone sails into frame and crashes into the roof of a parked car. Bob turns angrily toward the robot-

dialogues.speaker: HEY--
dialogues.text: ~-and is immediately SMACKED by the robot. Bob flies into the side of a building and tumbles to the street. Frozone and Helen distract the robot, heckling it and spreading out. It goes after them like an enraged beast. Dazed, Bob looks up and sees a strange device on the ground in front of him. He examines it, his eyes widening when he realizes what it is. He holds it up, yelling excitedly to the others-- BOB (CONT’D) SYNDROME’S REMOTE! ! WHAM! The bot comes down on Bob like a ton of bricks, lifting him high above the ground. Miraculously, Bob has held on to the remote, and he quickly stabs at the buttons, hoping to get lucky. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a BOOM one of the bot‘’s limbs RELEASES, sending it- and Bob-- crashing to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: AROUND THE CORNER
dialogues.text: Violet sees this. She turns to Dash.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: The remote controls the robot!

dialogues.speaker: WITH BOB AND THE OMNIDROID
dialogues.text: The Omnidroid knows this too, and it fires laser blasts at Bob to try to stop Bob from using the remote. Bob jumps clear, then hears his son from down the street.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: Hey, Dad! Throw it! Throw it!!

dialogues.speaker: GO LONG
dialogues.text: Bob gives the remote a MONSTER THROW, flinging it high into the air and across the river. Dash pivots and takes off after it. The Omni sees Dash and starts firing after him

dialogues.speaker: WITH DASH
dialogues.text: as he hits the water, jetting across the water’s surface as the Omni fires away. The water EXPLODES around Dash, but he concentrates on the remote, following it into his hands like an NFL receiver.

dialogues.speaker: I GOT IT
dialogues.text: Dash crosses the river and hits the streets on the other side, seemingly home free. But the Omni is still FIRING, and it hits some cars in Dash’s path, igniting their gas tanks. Suddenly Dash is surrounded by a wall of FLAMES!

dialogues.speaker: WITH BOB
dialogues.text: He runs toward Helen, who is closer to the Omnidroid.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: hears him. She grabs a heavy MANHOLE COVER, winding her elastic arm around a light pole to fling it-~ like an arrow-- at the OMNIDROID’S gun. Bull’s-eye.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE RIVER
dialogues.text: What follows amounts to a game of hot potato between the Supers and the robot over the remote: Frozone saves Dash from the circle of burning cars. The Robot sees this and goes after them. With Dash on his back, Frozone races across the river, freezing it in front of him as he goes. The robot JUMPS-- almost on top of them, creating a MASSIVE WAVE and throwing Dash and Frozone high into the air. Thinking fast, Frozone turns the wave into a wall of SNOW. It crashes over the streets, cushioning their fall. IN THE STREET —- NEARBY The remote clatters to the ground. Bob sees it and runs for it. The bot sees Bob and fires a claw-- catching Bob just as he was reaching for the remote. The CLAW-- with Bob inside-- tumbles end over end down the street. With Bob out of the way, the bot heads for the remote. Frozone ices the robot's path, causing the bot’s metal feet to slip and slide. Helen runs ahead of the bot, stretching herself into a tripwire across the stumbling robot's path. It CRASHES to the street. The bot LOOKS UP. The remote lies on the street just in front of it, easily within its grasp. The bot reaches out with a claw to destroy the remote. The remote magically JUMPS CLEAR. The bot tries again, and again the remote darts away. Riled now, the bot rears up and STABS wildly at the remote with all of its arms. We hear VIOLET shriek, as the remote repeatedly eludes the robot’s grasp: finally tangling its legs so badly that it topples over. Vi REAPPEARS, running back to rejoin the group in the middle of the street.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Mom, I got it! I got the remote!

dialogues.speaker: FROZONE
dialogues.text: A remote? A remote that controls what? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: il7.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Violet begins to fiddle with the remote’s CLICK-WHEEL, poking its buttons to no effect. The robot has gotten to its feet and lunges toward them. Violet shrieks and presses the button a last time. ROCKETS FIRE underneath the robot’s clawed feet, lifting the enormous machine into the air.

dialogues.speaker: FROZONE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The ROBOT??? Everyone ducks as the robot rockets overhead, crashing into a building at the end of the street. Like a woozy prizefighter, the Omnidroid gets back on its feet.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: It's coming back! Dash snatches the remote from Violet, aims it at the robot, spins the click-wheel and presses a button. Behind Dash (and unseen by all) the claws on the robot’s detached arm SPRING OPEN-~ flinging Bob into the air.

dialogues.speaker: DASH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That wasn’t right.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: (snatching remote back) Give me that!

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE STREET
dialogues.text: He climbs to his feet, muttering to himself.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: We can’t stop it...! The only thing hard enough to penetrate it is... A thought hits him. He turns, staring at the metal claw.

dialogues.speaker: BOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ..-itself.

dialogues.speaker: WITH FROZONE, HELEN
dialogues.text: Helen has the remote now and is trying to figure it out. The Omnidroid has them all in its sights and is lumbering toward them. The kids are starting to panic.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: No, this'll work! This’1ll work! {te Frozone} Lucius, try to buy us some time! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: FROZONE
dialogues.text: (re: button, exiting) Try the one next to it! Lucius takes off, throwing ice and skating down the street toward the approaching robot. He JUMPS off an ice ramp, his skates CONVERTING into a circular ski-disc in mid-air. He lands, throwing a massive ICE WALL in front of the robot.

dialogues.speaker: WITH BOB
dialogues.text: As he closes the claw into a massive arrowhead and starts charging down the street.

dialogues.speaker: WITH HELEN
dialogues.text: Helen dials the click-wheel on the remote, pokes a button.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME BOB
dialogues.text: The back of the claw suddenly FIRES a rocket engine. Bob veers crazily, trying to control it.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME HELEN
dialogues.text: She pokes the button again. Now close to the group, Bob’s claw rocket SWITCHES OFF. Bob gets an idea.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Wait a minute--! (yells to Helen) Press that button again! Helen presses a button. The claw blades start to spin.

dialogues.speaker: BOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No-- the other one! The FIRST ONE!

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: First button-- got it! The Omnidroid has broken through the first ice wall, and pounding away at a second one. Though Frozone's giving it all he’s got, the robot's starting to get through.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Helen looks at the remote, gestures at her kids. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Get outta here, kids! Find a safe spot!

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: We're not going anywhere!

dialogues.speaker: NOT YET
dialogues.text: The Omnidroid is pounding through the second wall. Bob shouts from behind them.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: WHAT’RE YOU WAITING FOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Omnidroid SHATTERS the last wall-- it’s almost on top of them. Helen presses the button. The claw-rocket FIRES. Bob aims it directly at the Omnidroid’s metal underbelly-

dialogues.speaker: EVERYBODY DUCK
dialogues.text: --and RELEASES IT. The giant metal arrow roars overhead and drills clean through the robot’s body, coming out the other side. For a long moment nothing happens. Then the gargantuan machine KEELS OVER and EXPLODES. It’s over. The family looks at each other, stunned. Frozone starts to chuckle. Bob smiles as he looks at his Super family. It feels like his best memories... only better. The seemingly empty city begins to come to life, as people emerge from their hiding places, converging in the street. People begin to spontaneously CHEER the heroes, welcoming the Supers’ return. Two ELDERLY GENTLEMEN stand together in the crowd. One nudges the other.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: See that? That’s the way you do it. That's Old School.

dialogues.speaker: OLLIE
dialogues.text: Yup. No school like the Old School.  120.

dialogues.speaker: ON A NEARBY ROOFTOP
dialogues.text: SYNDROME comes to. Looks over the edge to the streets below to find the battle over and the masses cheering-- not for him, but for the group of Supers. He DARKENS.

dialogues.speaker: WITH FROZONE AND THE INCREDIBLES
