dialogues.text: They drink in the cheers as the adoring crowd gathers around them.

dialogues.speaker: FROZONE
dialogues.text: Just like old times.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Just like old times... Bob slaps Frozone on the back, a little too hard. Frozone shakes it off.

dialogues.speaker: FROZONE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Hurt then, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long, black LIMO cruises down the street.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE LIMO
dialogues.text: Bob sits proudly with his family as Rick Dicker debriefs them. Everyone is enjoying the moment, save for Helen, who has already clicked back into “mother-mode” and is using the car phone to get messages.

dialogues.speaker: DICKER
dialogues.text: We've frozen all his assets. If Syndrome even sneezes we'll be there with a hanky and a pair of handcuffs. The people of this country are indebted to you. We’ll make good on it.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Does this mean we can come out of hiding?

dialogues.speaker: DICKER
dialogues.text: Let the politicians figure that one out. But I’ve been asked to assure you that we'll take care of everything else. You did good, Bob. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dash plays with the electric windows as Helen retrieves messages from the car phone. Window up, window down... KARI’S VOICE (beep) Hello, Mrs. Parr. Everything’s fine, but there's something-- unusual about Jack- Jack. Can you call me, okay? ..-window up, up, down, up. Finally Helen snaps.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: {to Dash) Come on! We’re in a limo! Bob is looking appreciatively at Violet.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: You’re wearing your hair back.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Huh? Oh, yeah. I just... yeah.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: It looks good.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: (blushing) Thanks, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: (to Bob) That was so cool when you threw that car.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Not as cool as you running on water.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: And Mom when she-- hey, Mom! That was sweet when you snagged that bad guy with your arm and kinda like whiplashed him into the other guy--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: I’m trying to listen to messages, honey...

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: And we totally aced those guys that tried to kill us! That was the best vacation ever! I love our family. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: KARI’S VOICE (beep) . . it’s me! Jack-Jack’s still fine but I’m really getting weirded out!! WHEN ARE YOU

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: {nudges Bob, shares phone) Bob, listen to this-- Helen is listening to the last message as the limo slows to a stop in front of their home--

dialogues.speaker: DICKER
dialogues.text: Here we are... KARI‘S VOICE (through phone, calmer) Hi, this is Kari. Sorry for freaking out. But your baby has special needs. Anyway, thanks for sending a replacement sitter--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: (looks at Bob, alarmed) “Replacement”...? I didn’t call for a replacement! Bob’s eyes widen. He and Helen jump from the car, followed by the kids. They cross the lawn and burst through the front door to REVEAL--

dialogues.speaker: SYNDROME
dialogues.text: who SPINS, hitting the family with his ZERO-POINT RAY. Cradling a sleeping Jack-Jack in his arms, he grins.

dialogues.speaker: SYNDROME
dialogues.text: Shh. The baby’s sleeping. He CACKLES. The Incredibles are frozen and helpless in the grasp of the ZERO-POINT. Only their eyes betray their desperation. SYNDROME (CONT’D) You took away my future. I'm simply returning the favor. Don’t worry. I'll be a good mentor; supportive, encouraging. Everything you weren’t. And in time, who knows? He might make a good sidekick...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Syndrome FLINGS the family into the bookcase. He points his power band toward the roof and blows a huge hole in it, revealing his MANTA JET hovering high above. Syndrome fires his jet-boots and TAKES OFF toward the jet.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: He‘s getting away, Bob! We have to do something! We have to do something now!

dialogues.speaker: ASCENDING WITH SYNDROME
dialogues.text: JACK-JACK awakens to the sight of his family and home receding beneath him. He CRIES, reaching out for them. Syndrome nears the MANTA JET. JACK-JACK’S crying turns angry and suddenly he BURSTS INTO FLAMES. Syndrome shrieks. Jack-Jack’s fire goes out, revealing that the baby has turned to METAL. Syndrome DROPS with the sudden weight. His jet-—boots compensate, but Syndrome is struggling to stay aloft. The baby’s flesh reverts to normal, but the baby begins to VIBRATE fiercely. Syndrome can barely keep hold of him.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUND
dialogues.text: Helen turns to Bob, panicked.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Something’s happening! What's happening??

dialogues.speaker: RESUME SYNDROME
dialogues.text: The vibrating baby begins to REDDEN, TRANSFORMING abruptly into mini-MONSTER. The Jack-Jack monster throws a headlock around Syndrome, laughing maniacally and starts to RIP APART Syndrome’s Jet-boots!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUND
dialogues.text: Bob and Helen watch helplessly.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: We have to stop him! Throw something!

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Tocan’t! I might hit Jack-Jack!

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: (realization, softly) Throw me...

dialogues.speaker: WITH SYNDROME AND JACK-JACK
dialogues.text: Jack-Jack RIPS a valve from Syndrome’s jet-boots, which PROPELS him upward, slamming his head into the jet’s wing. He loses hold of Jack-Jack, who FALLS~-

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUND
dialogues.text: Helen SEES THIS, turns to Bob--

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Bob-- THROW ME!! Helen leaps into Bob's arms, forming into a SPEAR shape. BOB takes aim and FLINGS HER toward the falling baby.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SKY
dialogues.text: HELEN SOARS-- and GRABS JACK-JACK! She quickly BLOOMS into a parachute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SYNDROME regains control. He successfully docks with the hovering Manta Jet. He stands at the docking doors, his cape blowing dramatically upwards...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUND
dialogues.text: Bob looks around wildly for a way to get at Syndrome, and spies his sports car. Regret flashes across his face--

dialogues.speaker: SYNDROME
dialogues.text: I WILL GET YOUR SON!! I’LL-- oh no... Syndrome’s eyes go wide. BOB’S CAR is soaring toward him, tumbling end over end towards the MANTA JET. Syndrome jumps back as the crafts COLLIDE, blowing him off his feet and up over the wing, toward the turbines. Clawing madly to find purchase, he LOOKS over his shoulder in time to see the end of his CAPE sucked into the intake. Syndrome SCREAMS as he’s YANKED OUT OF FRAME-

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUND
dialogues.text: BOB, DASH & VI react as the MANTA JET EXPLODES.  125.

dialogues.speaker: DESCENDING WITH HELEN AND JACK-JACK
dialogues.text: Helen cradles Jack-Jack facing upwards, his back toward the ground. He looks at her, giggling and cooing.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Look at Mommy, honey. Don’t look down, Mommy's got you. Everything’s alright... But Jack-Jack sees burning wreckage coming toward them and starts to SHRIEK, pointing upwards. Helen turns to see it as--

dialogues.speaker: MEANINGFUL LOOK
dialogues.text: HELEN (CONT‘D) That’s my girl.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: Does this mean we have to move again? Everyone chuckles at this. The smoke begins to clear, REVEALING a lone witness to this cataclysmic event-- --the Big Wheel KID, whose eyes are as big as dinner plates.

dialogues.speaker: RID
dialogues.text: Ooohh, man, THAT WAS TOTALLY WICKED! FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stadium parking lot is about half full ona beautiful cloudless day. The marquee announces JUNIOR HIGH TRACK FINALS.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE STADIUM
dialogues.text: Young runners loosen up at the starting line of the hundred-yard dash. Dash is among them. He waves to the stands.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE STANDS
dialogues.text: Bob, Helen and Jack-Jack wave back. Coming down the steps is none other than Violet’s crush, TONY RYDINGER. He waves cooly at some friends and heads toward the concession stand... PAUSING when he sees Violet and a friend talking nearby. He approaches them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: {to Violet) Hey.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You're... Violet, right? With a smile, Vi's friend exits.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: That’s me.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You look... different.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: I feel different. Is different okay...?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Different is great. Would you... uh...

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET TONY
dialogues.text: Yeah...? Do you... want...

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET TONY
dialogues.text: Yeah... Maybe... we, uh... could-- Violet silences Tony with a single finger on his lips. Tony stares at her in shock and wonder.

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: I like movies. I’1l buy the popcorn. (then, gently) Okay...?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Good. A movie. Okay. Friday?

dialogues.speaker: VIOLET
dialogues.text: (big smile) Friday.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FIELD
dialogues.text: The starter pistol FIRES and the runners take off. Dash jogs well behind the pack in a confident, easy trot. In the stands Bob, Helen, and Violet cheer Dash on. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOB, HELEN
dialogues.text: Got! Go, Dash, GO!! Run. Run! RUNI! (etc.) Dash hears them and looks toward the stands.

dialogues.speaker: GO, DASH, GO
dialogues.text: GAS! (etc.) Dash, his eyes still on his family, accelerates a little and quickly moves toward the front of the pack... BOB & HELEN (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: --BUT NOT TOO MUCH
dialogues.text: IT BACK!! EASE UP! Slow down a little!! Dash, clearly confused now, furrows his brows as he again drops back. The family shouts LOUDER~- BOB & HELEN (CONT’D) But don't give up!! Make it close--

dialogues.speaker: SECOND
dialogues.text: Understanding, Dash accelerates just enough to scare the leader, crossing the finish line inches behind him.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE STANDS
dialogues.text: the Incredibles are ecstatic. They cheer and laugh and jostle each other as if Dash had won Olympic gold. Dash stands in the cluster of panting, red-faced boys, not even winded, and beams at his proud family.

dialogues.speaker: BOB, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That’s my boy!!

dialogues.speaker: STADIUM PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: The family crosses the parking lot, Dash sitting atop Bob’s shoulders, clutching his second-place trophy. Everyone is happy and together.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: You were great. out there, honey. We're so proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: DASH
dialogues.text: T saw you in the stands. I didn’t know what the heck you wanted me to do...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The ground begins to QUAKE. The INCREDIBLES stop as the low RUMBLE grows louder. On the far side of the lot, cars begin to be thrown into the air, tossed about like toys. A GARGANTUAN DRILL spirals out of the ground, throwing dirt and chunks of asphalt in all directions. People run screaming as the enormous metallic vehicle crests and crashes to earth. A door opens on top and a hulking figure in dirty overalls emerges atop a rising platform. His ragged voice amplified through a loudspeaker, the UNDERMINER speaks-~

dialogues.speaker: DECLARE WAR ON PEACE AND HAPPINESS
dialogues.text: WILL TREMBLE BEFORE ME! (etc.) CAMERA pans off Bob as he glances at his family. They've already donned their masks, ready as they'll ever be. CAMERA returns to Bob, revealing that he too has put on his mask. He turns toward their new nemesis and SMILES, RIPS his shirt OPEN TO REVEAL the “i" insignia on the chest of his Supersuit underneath, the logo of-~ ~-THE INCREDIBLES .
